133.1: Lift up your hands to the sanctuary, And bless ye the LORD.
133.0: A Song of Ascents. Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye servants of the LORD, That stand in the house of the LORD in the night seasons.
133.2: The LORD bless thee out of Zion; Even He that made heaven and earth.

132.1: It is like the precious oil upon the head, Coming down upon the beard; Even Aaron's beard, That cometh down upon the collar of his garments;
132.0: A Song of Ascents; of David. Behold, how good and how pleasant it is For brethren to dwell together in unity!
132.2: Like the dew of Hermon, That cometh down upon the mountains of Zion; For there the LORD commanded the blessing, Even life for ever.

131.11: If thy children keep My covenant And My testimony that I shall teach them, Their children also for ever shall sit upon thy throne.'
131.10: The LORD swore unto David in truth; He will not turn back from it: 'Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
131.13: 'This is My resting-place for ever; Here will I dwell; for I have desired it.
131.12: For the LORD hath chosen Zion; He hath desired it for His habitation:
131.15: Her priests also will I clothe with salvation; And her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
131.14: I will abundantly bless her provision; I will give her needy bread in plenty.
131.17: His enemies will I clothe with shame; But upon himself shall his crown shine.'
131.16: There will I make a horn to shoot up unto David, There have I ordered a lamp for Mine anointed.
131.1: How he swore unto the LORD, And vowed unto the Mighty One of Jacob:
131.0: A Song of Ascents. LORD, remember unto David All his affliction;
131.3: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, Nor slumber to mine eyelids;
131.2: ‘Surely I will not come into the tent of my house, Nor go up into the bed that is spread for me;
131.5: Lo, we heard of it as being in Ephrath; We found it in the field of athe wood.
131.4: Until I find out a place for the LORD, A dwelling-place for the Mighty One of Jacob.'
131.7: Arise, O LORD, unto Thy resting-place; Thou, and the ark of Thy strength.
131.6: Let us go into His dwelling-place; Let us worship at His footstool. .
131.9: For Thy servant David's sake Turn not away the face of Thine anointed.
131.8: Let Thy priests be clothed with righteousness; And let Thy saints shout for joy.

130.1: Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul; Like a weaned child with his mother; My soul is with me like a weaned child.
130.0: A Song of Ascents; of David. LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; Neither do I exercise myself in things too great, or in things too wonderful for me.
130.2: O Israel, hope in the LORD From this time forth and for ever.

137.1: I will bow down toward Thy holy temple, And give thanks unto Thy name for Thy mercy and for Thy truth; For Thou hast magnified Thy word above all Thy name.
137.0: [A Psalm] of David. I will give Thee thanks with my whole heart, In the presence of the mighty will I sing praises unto Thee.
137.3: All the kings of the earth shall give Thee thanks, O LORD, For they have heard the words of Thy mouth.
137.2: In the day that I called, Thou didst answer me; Thou didst encourage me in my soul with strength.
137.5: For though the LORD be high, yet regardeth He the lowly, And the haughty He knoweth from afar.
137.4: Yea, they shall sing of the ways of the LORD; For great is the glory of the LORD.
137.7: The LORD will accomplish that which concerneth me; Thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever; Forsake not the work of Thine own hands.
137.6: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, Thou quickenest me; Thou stretchest forth Thy hand against the wrath of mine enemies, And Thy right hand doth save me.

136.1: Upon the willows in the midst thereof We hanged up our harps.
136.0: By the rivers of Babylon, There we sat down, yea, we wept, When we remembered Zion.
136.3: How shall we sing the LORD’S song In a foreign land?
136.2: For there they that led us captive asked of us words of song, And our tormentors asked of us mirth: ‘Sing us one of the songs of Zion.'
136.5: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, If I remember thee not; If I set not Jerusalem Above my chiefest joy.
136.4: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand forget her cunning.
136.7: O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed; Happy shall he be, that repayeth thee As thou hast served us.
136.6: Remember, O LORD, against the children of Edom The day of Jerusalem; Who said: 'Rase it, rase it, Even to the foundation thereof.'
136.8: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones Against the rock.

135.24: Who giveth food to all flesh, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.25: O give thanks unto the God of heaven, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.20: And gave their land for a heritage, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.21: Even a heritage unto Israel His servant, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.22: Who remembered us in our low estate, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.23: And hath delivered us from our adversaries, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.1: O give thanks unto the God of gods, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.0: O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, For His mercy endureth for ever. .
135.3: To Him who alone doeth great wonders, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.2: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.5: To Him that spread forth the earth above the waters, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.4: To Him that by understanding made the heavens, for His mercy endureth for ever.
135.7: The sun to rule by day, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.6: To Him that made great lights, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.9: To Him that smote Egypt in their first-born, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.8: The moon and stars to rule by night, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.11: With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.10: And brought out Israel from among them, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.13: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.12: To Him who divided the Red Sea in sunder, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.15: To Him that led His people through the wilderness, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.14: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.17: And slew mighty kings, For His mercy endureth for ever.
135.16: To Him that smote great kings; For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.19: And Og king of Bashan, For His mercy endureth for ever;
135.18: Sihon king of the Amorites, For His mercy endureth for ever;

134.11: And gave their land for a heritage, A heritage unto Israel His people.
134.10: Sihon king of the Amorites, And Og king of Bashan, And all the kingdoms of Canaan;
134.13: For the LORD will judge His people, And repent Himself for His servants.
134.12: O LORD, Thy name endureth for ever; Thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.
134.15: They have mouths, but they speak not; Eyes have they, but they see not;
134.14: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, The work of men's hands.
134.17: They that make them shall be like unto them; Yea, every one that trusteth in them.
134.16: They have ears, but they hear not; Neither is there any breath in their mouths.
134.19: O house of Levi, bless ye the LORD; Ye that fear the LORD, bless ye the LORD.
134.18: O house of Israel, bless ye the LORD; O house of Aaron, bless ye the LORD;
134.20: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, Who dwelleth at Jerusalem. Hallelujah.
134.1: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, In the courts of the house of our God.
134.0: Hallelujah. Praise ye the name of the LORD; Give praise, O ye servants of the LORD,
134.3: For the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto Himself, And Israel for His own treasure.
134.2: Praise ye the LORD, for the LORD is good; Sing praises unto His name, for it is pleasant.
134.5: Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that hath He done, In heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps;
134.4: For I know that the LORD is great, And that our Lord is above all gods.
134.7: Who smote the first-born of Egypt, Both of man and beast.
134.6: Who causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; He maketh lightnings for the rain; He bringeth forth the wind out of His treasuries.
134.9: Who smote many nations, And slew mighty kings:
134.8: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, Upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

139.11: A slanderer shall not be established in the earth; The violent and evil man shall be hunted with thrust upon thrust.
139.10: Let burning coals fall upon them; Let them be cast into the fire, Into deep pits, that they rise not up again.
139.13: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto Thy name; The upright shall dwell in Thy presence.
139.12: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the poor, And the right of the needy.
139.1: Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man; Preserve me from the violent man;
139.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
139.3: They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent; Vipers' venom is under their lips. Selah
139.2: Who devise evil things in their heart; Every day do they stir up wars.
139.5: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; They have spread a net by the wayside; They have set gins for me. Selah
139.4: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; Preserve me from the violent man; Who have purposed to make my steps slip.
139.7: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, Who hast screened my head in the day of battle,
139.6: I have said unto the LORD: 'Thou art my God'; Give ear, O LORD, unto the voice of my supplications.
139.9: As for the head of those that compass me about, Let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
139.8: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; Further not his evil device, so that they exalt themselves. Selah

138.20: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate Thee? And do not I strive with those that rise up against Thee?
138.21: I hate them with utmost hatred; I count them mine enemies.
138.22: Search me, O God, and know my heart, Try me, and know my thoughts;
138.23: And see if there be any way in me that is grievous, And lead me in the way everlasting.
138.1: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, Thou understandest my thought afar off.
138.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David. O LORD, Thou hast searched me, and known me. .
138.3: For there is not a word in my tongue, But, lo, O LORD, Thou knowest it altogether.
138.2: Thou measurest my going about and my lying down, And art acquainted with all my ways.
138.5: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; Too high, I cannot attain unto it.
138.4: Thou hast hemmed me in behind and before, And laid Thy hand upon me.
138.7: If I ascend up into heaven, Thou art there; If I make my bed in the nether-world, behold, Thou art there.
138.6: Whither shall I go from Thy spirit? Or whither shall I flee from Thy presence?
138.9: Even there would Thy hand lead me, And Thy right hand would hold me.
138.8: If I take the wings of the morning, And dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
138.11: Even the darkness is not too dark for Thee, But the night shineth as the day; The darkness is even as the light.
138.10: And if I say: ‘Surely the darkness shall envelop me, And the light about me shall be night';
138.13: I will give thanks unto Thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; Wonderful are Thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
138.12: For Thou hast made my reins; Thou hast knit me together in my mother's womb.
138.15: Thine eyes did see mine unformed substance, And in Thy book they were all written— Even the days that were fashioned, When as yet there was none of them.
138.14: My frame was not hidden from Thee, When I was made in secret, And curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
138.17: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand; Were I to come to the end of them, I would still be with Thee.
138.16: How weighty also are Thy thoughts unto me, O God! How great is the sum of them!
138.19: Who utter Thy name with wicked thought, They take it for falsehood, even Thine enemies— .
138.18: If Thou but wouldest slay the wicked, O God— Depart from me therefore, ye men of blood;

24.20: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, Because I wait for Thee.
24.21: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
24.1: O my God, in Thee have I trusted, let me not be ashamed; Let not mine enemies triumph over me.
24.0: [A Psalm] of David. Unto Thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.
24.3: Show me Thy ways, O LORD; teach me Thy paths.
24.2: Yea, none that wait for Thee shall be ashamed; They shall be ashamed that deal treacherously without cause.
24.5: Remember, O LORD, Thy compassions and Thy mercies; For they have been from of old.
24.4: Guide me in Thy truth, and teach me; For Thou art the God of my salvation; For Thee do I wait all the day.
24.7: Good and upright is the LORD; Therefore doth He instruct sinners in the way.
24.6: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions; According to Thy mercy remember Thou me, For Thy goodness' sake, O LORD.
24.9: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth Unto such as keep His covenant and His testimonies.
24.8: He guideth The humble in justice; And He teacheth the humble His way.
24.11: What man is he that feareth the LORD? Him will He instruct in the way that He should choose.
24.10: For Thy name's sake, O LORD, Pardon mine iniquity, for it is great.
24.13: The counsel of the LORD is with them that fear Him; And His covenant, to make them know it.
24.12: His soul shall abide in prosperity; And his seed shall inherit the land.
24.15: Turn Thee unto me, and be gracious unto me; For I am solitary and afflicted.
24.14: Mine eyes are ever toward the LORD; For He will bring forth my feet out of the net.
24.17: See mine affliction and my travail; And forgive all my sins.
24.16: The troubles of my heart are enlarged; O bring Thou me out of my distresses.
24.19: O keep my soul, and deliver me; Let me not be ashamed, for I have taken refuge in Thee.
24.18: Consider how many are mine enemies, And the cruel hatred wherewith they hate me. .

25.11: My foot standeth in an even place; in the congregations will I bless the LORD.
25.10: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity; Redeem me, and be gracious unto me.
25.1: Examine me, O LORD, and try me; test my reins and my heart.
25.0: [A Psalm] of David. Judge me, O LORD, for I have walked in mine integrity, and I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
25.3: I have not sat with men of falsehood; neither will I go in with dissemblers.
25.2: For Thy mercy is before mine eyes; and I have walked in Thy truth.
25.5: I will wash my hands in innocency; so will I compass Thine altar, O LORD,
25.4: I hate the gathering of evil doers, and will not sit with the wicked.
25.7: LORD, I love the habitation of Thy house, and the place where Thy glory dwelleth.
25.6: That I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard, and tell of all Thy wondrous works.
25.9: In whose hands is craftiness, and their right hand is full of bribes.
25.8: Gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with men of blood;

26.11: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine adversaries; For false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out violence.
26.10: Teach me Thy way, O LORD; And lead me in an even path, Because of them that lie in wait for me.
26.13: Wait on the LORD; Be strong, and let thy heart take courage; Yea, wait thou for the LORD.
26.12: If I had not believed to look upon the goodness of the LORD In the land of the living!—
26.1: When evil-doers came upon me to eat up my flesh, Even mine adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell.
26.0: [A Psalm] of David. The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
26.3: One thing have I asked of the LORD, that will I seek after: That I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, To behold the graciousness of the LORD, and to visit early in His temple.
26.2: Though a host should encamp against me, My heart shall not fear; Though war should rise up against me, Even then will I be confident.
26.5: And now shall my head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me; And I will offer in His tabernacle sacrifices with trumpet-sound; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.
26.4: For He concealeth me in His pavilion in the day of evil; He hideth me in the covert of His tent; He lifteth me up upon a rock. .
26.7: In Thy behalf my heart hath said: ‘Seek ye My face'; Thy face, LORD, will I seek.
26.6: Hear, O LORD, when I call with my voice, And be gracious unto me, and answer me.
26.9: For though my father and my mother have forsaken me, The LORD will take me up.
26.8: Hide not Thy face far from me; Put not Thy servant away in anger; Thou hast been my help; Cast me not off, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

27.1: Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto Thee, When I lift up my hands toward Thy holy Sanctuary.
27.0: [A Psalm] of David. Unto thee, O LORD, do I call; My Rock, be not Thou deaf unto me; Lest, if Thou be silent unto me, I become like them that go down into the pit.
27.3: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the evil of their endeavours; Give them after the work of their hands; Render to them their desert.
27.2: Draw me not away with the wicked, And with the workers of iniquity; Who speak peace with their neighbours, But evil is in their hearts.
27.5: Blessed be the LORD, Because He hath heard the voice of my supplications.
27.4: Because they give no heed to the works of the LORD, Nor to the operation of His hands; He will break them down and not build them up.
27.7: The LORD is a strength unto them; And He is a stronghold of salvation to His anointed.
27.6: The LORD is my strength and my shield, In Him hath my heart trusted, And I am helped; Therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth, And with my song will I praise Him.
27.8: Save Thy people, and bless Thine inheritance; And tend them, and carry them for ever.

20.11: For they intended evil against thee, They imagined a device, wherewith they shall not prevail.
20.10: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.
20.13: Be Thou exalted, O LORD, in Thy strength; so will we sing and praise Thy power.
20.12: For thou shalt make them turn their back, Thou shalt make ready with thy bowstrings against the face of them.
20.1: O LORD, in Thy strength the king rejoiceth; and in Thy salvation how greatly doth he exult!
20.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
20.3: For Thou meetest him with choicest blessings; Thou settest a crown of fine gold on his head.
20.2: Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and the request of his lips Thou hast not withholden. Selah
20.5: His glory is great through Thy salvation; Honour and majesty dost Thou lay upon him.
20.4: He asked life of Thee, Thou gavest it him; even length of days for ever and ever.
20.7: For the king trusteth in the LORD, yea, in the mercy of the Most High; he shall not be moved.
20.6: For Thou makest him most blessed for ever; Thou makest him glad with joy in Thy presence.
20.9: Thou shalt make them as a fiery furnace in the time of thine anger; The LORD shall swallow them up in His wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
20.8: Thy hand shall be equal to all thine enemies; Thy right hand shall overtake those that hate thee.

21.24: For He hath not despised nor abhorred the lowliness of the poor; neither hath He hid His face from him; but when he cried unto Him, He heard.'
21.25: From Thee cometh my praise in the great congregation; I will pay my vows before them that fear Him.
21.26: Let the humble eat and be satisfied; let them praise the LORD that seek after Him; may your heart be quickened for ever!
21.27: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn unto the LORD; and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before Thee.
21.20: Deliver my soul from the sword; mine only one from the power of the dog.
21.21: Save me from the lion's mouth; yea, from the horns of the wild-oxen do Thou answer me.
21.22: I will declare Thy name unto my brethren; in the midst of the congregation will I praise Thee.
21.23: 'Ye that fear the LORD, praise Him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify Him; and stand in awe of Him, all ye the seed of Israel.
21.28: For the kingdom is the LORD’S; and He is the ruler over the nations.
21.29: All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship; all they that go down to the dust shall kneel before Him, even he that cannot keep his soul alive.
21.1: My God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me, and art far from my help at the words of my cry?
21.0: For the Leader; upon Aijeleth ha-Shahar. A Psalm of David.
21.3: Yet Thou art holy, O Thou that art enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
21.2: O my God, I call by day, but Thou answerest not; and at night, and there is no surcease for me.
21.5: Unto Thee they cried, and escaped; in Thee did they trust, and were not ashamed.
21.4: In Thee did our fathers trust; they trusted, and Thou didst deliver them.
21.7: All they that see me laugh me to scorn; they shoot out the lip, they shake the head:
21.6: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
21.9: For Thou art He that took me out of the womb; Thou madest me trust when I was upon my mother's breasts.
21.8: 'Let him commit himself unto the LORD! let Him rescue him; let Him deliver him, seeing He delighteth in him.'
21.11: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
21.10: Upon Thee I have been cast from my birth; Thou art my God from my mother's womb.
21.13: They open wide their mouth against me, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
21.12: Many bulls have encompassed me; strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.
21.15: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my throat; and Thou layest me in the dust of death.
21.14: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint; my heart is become like wax; it is melted in mine inmost parts.
21.17: I may count all my bones; they look and gloat over me.
21.16: For dogs have encompassed me; a company of evil-doers have inclosed me; like a lion, they are at my hands and my feet.
21.19: But Thou, O LORD, be not far off; O Thou my strength, hasten to help me.
21.18: They part my garments among them, and for my vesture do they cast lots.
21.31: They shall come and shall declare His righteousness Unto a people that shall be born, that He hath done it.
21.30: A seed shall serve him; It shall be told of the Lord unto the next generation.

22.1: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures; He leadeth me beside the still waters.
22.0: A Psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
22.3: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for Thou art with me; Thy rod and Thy staff, they comfort me.
22.2: He restoreth my soul; He guideth me in straight paths for His name's sake.
22.5: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life; And I shall dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.
22.4: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies; Thou hast anointed my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

23.1: For He hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.
23.0: A Psalm of David. The earth is the LORD’S, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.
23.3: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; Who hath not taken My name in vain, and hath not sworn deceitfully.
23.2: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the LORD? And who shall stand in His holy place?
23.5: Such is the generation of them that seek after Him, that seek Thy face, even Jacob. Selah
23.4: He shall receive a blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
23.7: 'Who is the King of glory?' 'The LORD strong and mighty, The LORD mighty in battle.'
23.6: Lift up your heads, O ye gates, and be ye lifted up, ye everlasting doors; that the King of glory may come in.
23.9: 'Who then is the King of glory?' 'The LORD of hosts; He is the King of glory.' Selah
23.8: Lift up your heads, O ye gates, Yea, lift them up, ye everlasting doors; That the King of glory may come in.

28.10: The LORD will give strength unto His people; The LORD will bless his people with peace.
28.1: Ascribe unto the LORD the glory due unto His name; Worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
28.0: A Psalm of David. Ascribe unto the LORD, O ye sons of might, Ascribe unto the LORD glory and strength.
28.3: The voice of the LORD is powerful; The voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
28.2: The voice of the LORD is upon the waters; The God of glory thundereth, Even the LORD upon many waters.
28.5: He maketh them also to skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild-ox.
28.4: The voice of the LORD breaketh the cedars; yea, the LORD breaketh in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.
28.7: The voice of the LORD shaketh the wilderness; The LORD shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.
28.6: The voice of the LORD heweth out flames of fire.
28.9: The LORD sat enthroned at the flood; Yea, the LORD sitteth as King for ever.
28.8: The voice of the LORD maketh the hinds to calve, And strippeth the forests bare; And in His temple all say: 'Glory.'

29.11: Thou didst turn for me my mourning into dancing; Thou didst loose my sackcloth, and gird me with gladness;
29.10: Hear, O LORD, and be gracious unto me; LORD, be Thou my helper.'
29.12: So that my glory may sing praise to Thee, and not be silent; O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto Thee for ever.
29.1: I will extol thee, O LORD, for Thou hast raised me up, and hast not suffered mine enemies to rejoice over me.
29.0: A Psalm; a Song at the Dedication of the House; of David.
29.3: O LORD, Thou broughtest up my soul from the nether-world; Thou didst kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
29.2: O LORD my God, I cried unto Thee, and Thou didst heal me;
29.5: For His anger is but for a moment, His favour is for a life-time; weeping may tarry for the night, but joy cometh in the morning.
29.4: Sing praise unto the LORD, O ye His godly ones, and give thanks to His holy name.
29.7: Thou hadst established, O LORD, in Thy favour my mountain as a stronghold— Thou didst hide Thy face; I was affrighted.
29.6: Now I had said in my security: 'I shall never be moved.'
29.9: 'What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise Thee? shall it declare Thy truth?
29.8: Unto Thee, O LORD, did I call, And unto the LORD I made supplication:

0.1: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in His law doth he meditate day and night.
0.0: HAPPY IS the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked, Nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seat of the scornful.
0.3: Not so the wicked; but they are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.
0.2: And he shall be like a tree planted by streams of water, that bringeth forth its fruit in its season, and whose leaf doth not wither; and in whatsoever he doeth he shall prosper.
0.5: For the LORD regardeth the way of the righteous; but the way of the wicked shall perish.
0.4: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

4.11: So shall all those that take refuge in Thee rejoice, They shall ever shout for joy, And Thou shalt shelter them; Let them also that love Thy name exult in Thee.
4.10: Hold them guilty, O God, Let them fall by their own counsels; Cast them down in the multitude of their transgressions; For they have rebelled against Thee.
4.12: For Thou dost bless the righteous; O LORD, Thou dost encompass him with favour as with a shield.
4.1: Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.
4.0: For the Leader; upon the Nehiloth. A Psalm of David.
4.3: O LORD, in the morning shalt Thou hear my voice; In the morning will I order my prayer unto Thee, and will look forward.
4.2: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God; For unto Thee do I pray.
4.5: The boasters shall not stand in Thy sight; Thou hatest all workers of iniquity.
4.4: For Thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness; Evil shall not sojourn with Thee.
4.7: But as for me, in the abundance of Thy lovingkindness will I come into Thy house; I will bow down toward Thy holy temple in the fear of Thee.
4.6: Thou destroyest them that speak falsehood; The LORD abhorreth the man of blood and of deceit.
4.9: For there is no sincerity in their mouth; Their inward part is a yawning gulf, Their throat is an open sepulchre; They make smooth their tongue.
4.8: O LORD, lead me in Thy righteousness because of them that lie in wait for me; Make Thy way straight before my face.

8.11: Sing praises to the LORD, who dwelleth in Zion; Declare among the peoples His doings.
8.10: And they that know Thy name will put their trust in Thee; For thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek Thee.
8.13: Be gracious unto me, O LORD, Behold mine affliction at the hands of them that hate me; Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death;
8.12: For He that avengeth blood hath remembered them; He hath not forgotten the cry of the humble.
8.15: The nations are sunk down in the pit that they made; In the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
8.14: That I may tell of all Thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion, That I may rejoice in Thy salvation.
8.17: The wicked shall return to the nether-world, Even all the nations that forget God.
8.16: The LORD hath made Himself known, He hath executed judgment, The wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah
8.19: Arise, O LORD, let not man prevail; Let the nations be judged in Thy sight.
8.18: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten, Nor the expectation of the poor perish for ever.
8.20: Set terror over them, O LORD; Let the nations know they are but men. Selah
8.1: I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart; I will tell of all Thy marvellous works.
8.0: For the Leader; upon Muthlabben. A Psalm of David.
8.3: When mine enemies are turned back, They stumble and perish at Thy presence;
8.2: I will be glad and exult in Thee; I will sing praise to Thy name, O Most High:
8.5: Thou hast rebuked the nations, Thou hast destroyed the wicked, Thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever.
8.4: For Thou hast maintained my right and my cause; Thou sattest upon the throne as the righteous Judge.
8.7: But the LORD is enthroned for ever; He hath established His throne for judgment.
8.6: O thou enemy, the waste places are come to an end for ever; And the cities which thou didst uproot, Their very memorial is perished.
8.9: The LORD also will be a high tower for the oppressed, A high tower in times of trouble;
8.8: And He will judge the world in righteousness, He will minister judgment to the peoples with equity.

119.1: O LORD, deliver my soul from lying lips, From a deceitful tongue.
119.0: A Song of Ascents. In my distress I called unto the LORD, And He answered me.
119.3: Sharp arrows of the mighty, With coals of broom.
119.2: What shall be given unto thee, and what shall be done more unto thee, Thou deceitful tongue?
119.5: My soul hath full long had her dwelling With him that hateth peace.
119.4: Woe is me, that I sojourn with Meshech, That I dwell beside the tents of Kedar!
119.6: I am all peace; But when I speak, they are for war.

120.1: My help cometh from the LORD, Who made heaven and earth.
120.0: A Song of Ascents. I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains: From whence shall my help come?
120.3: Behold, He that keepeth Israel Doth neither slumber nor sleep.
120.2: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved; He that keepeth thee will not slumber.
120.5: The sun shall not smite thee by day, Nor the moon by night.
120.4: The LORD is thy keeper; The LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.
120.7: The LORD shall guard thy going out and thy coming in, From this time forth and for ever.
120.6: The LORD shall keep thee from all evil; He shall keep thy soul.

121.1: Our feet are standing within thy gates, O Jerusalem;
121.0: A Song of Ascents; of David. I rejoiced when they said unto me: 'Let us go unto the house of the LORD.'
121.3: Whither the tribes went up, even the tribes of the LORD, as a testimony unto Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the LORD.
121.2: Jerusalem, that art builded as a city that is compact together;
121.5: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem; May they prosper that love thee.
121.4: For there were set thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
121.7: For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say: 'Peace be within thee.'
121.6: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.
121.8: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good.

122.1: Behold, as the eyes of servants unto the hand of their master, As the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; So our eyes look unto the LORD our God, Until He be gracious unto us.
122.0: A Song of Ascents. Unto Thee I lift up mine eyes, O Thou that art enthroned in the heavens.
122.3: Our soul is full sated With the scorning of those that are at ease, And with the contempt of the proud oppressors.
122.2: Be gracious unto us, O LORD, be gracious unto us; For we are full sated with contempt.

123.1: 'If it had not been the LORD who was for us, When men rose up against us,
123.0: A Song of Ascents; of David. 'If it had not been the LORD who was for us', Let Israel now say;
123.3: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul;
123.2: Then they had swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us;
123.5: Blessed be the LORD, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.
123.4: Then the proud waters Had gone over our soul.'
123.7: Our help is in the name of the LORD, Who made heaven and earth.
123.6: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; The snare is broken, and we are escaped.

124.1: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, So the LORD is round about His people, From this time forth and for ever.
124.0: A Song of Ascents. They that trust in the LORD Are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abideth for ever.
124.3: Do good, O LORD, unto the good, And to them that are upright in their hearts.
124.2: For the rod of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; That the righteous put not forth their hands unto iniquity.
124.4: But as for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, The LORD will lead them away with the workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel.

125.1: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing; then said they among the nations: 'The LORD hath done great things with these.'
125.0: A Song of Ascents. When the LORD brought back those that returned to Zion, We were like unto them that dream.
125.3: Turn our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the dry land.
125.2: The LORD hath done great things with us; we are rejoiced.
125.5: Though he goeth on his way weeping that beareth the measure of seed, He shall come home with joy, bearing his sheaves.
125.4: They that sow in tears Shall reap in joy.

126.1: It is vain for you that ye rise early, and sit up late, Ye that eat the bread of toil; So He giveth unto His beloved in sleep.
126.0: A Song of Ascents; of Solomon. Except the LORD build the house, They labour in vain that build it; Except the LORD keep the city, The watchman waketh but in vain.
126.3: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, So are the children of one's youth.
126.2: Lo, children are a heritage of the LORD; The fruit of the womb is a reward.
126.4: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them; They shall not be put to shame, When they speak with their enemies in the gate.

127.1: When thou eatest the labour of thy hands, Happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
127.0: A Song of Ascents. Happy is every one that feareth the LORD, That walketh in His ways.
127.3: Behold, surely thus shall the man be blessed That feareth the LORD.
127.2: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine, in the innermost parts of thy house; Thy children like olive plants, round about thy table.
127.5: And see thy children's children. Peace be upon Israel!
127.4: The LORD bless thee out of Zion; And see thou the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life;

128.1: 'Much have they afflicted me from my youth up; But they have not prevailed against me.
128.0: A Song of Ascents. 'Much have they afflicted me from my youth up', Let Israel now say;
128.3: The LORD is righteous; He hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.'
128.2: The plowers plowed upon my back; They made long their furrows.
128.5: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, Which withereth afore it springeth up;
128.4: Let them be ashamed and turned backward, All they that hate Zion.
128.7: Neither do they that go by say: ‘The blessing of the LORD be upon you; We bless you in the name of the LORD.'
128.6: Wherewith the reaper filleth not his hand, Nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

129.1: Lord, hearken unto my voice; let Thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
129.0: A Song of Ascents. Out of the depths have I called Thee, O LORD.
129.3: For with Thee there is forgiveness, that Thou mayest be feared.
129.2: If Thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who could stand?
129.5: My soul waiteth for the Lord, more than watchmen for the morning; yea, more than watchmen for the morning.
129.4: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in His word do I hope.
129.7: And He will redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
129.6: O Israel, hope in the LORD; for with the LORD there is mercy, and with Him is plenteous redemption.

118.165: I have hoped for Thy salvation, O LORD, And have done Thy commandments.
118.133: Redeem me from the oppression of man, And I will observe Thy precepts.
118.132: Order my footsteps by Thy word; And let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
118.131: Turn Thee towards me, and be gracious unto me, As is Thy wont to do unto those that love Thy name.
118.130: I opened wide my mouth, and panted; For I longed for Thy commandments.
118.137: Thou hast commanded Thy testimonies in righteousness and exceeding faithfulness.
118.136: TZADE. Righteous art Thou, O LORD, And upright are Thy judgments.
118.135: Mine eyes run down with rivers of water, Because they observe not Thy law.
118.134: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy servant; And teach me Thy statutes.
118.139: Thy word is tried to the uttermost, and Thy servant loveth it.
118.138: My zeal hath undone me, because mine adversaries have forgotten Thy words.
118.166: My soul hath observed Thy testimonies; And I love them exceedingly.
118.24: My soul cleaveth unto the dust; quicken Thou me according to Thy word.
118.25: I told of my ways, and Thou didst answer me; teach me Thy statutes.
118.26: Make me to understand the way of Thy precepts, that I may talk of Thy wondrous works.
118.27: My soul melteth away for heaviness; sustain me according unto Thy word.
118.20: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, that do err from Thy commandments.
118.21: Take away from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept Thy testimonies.
118.22: Even though princes sit and talk against me, Thy servant doth meditate in Thy statutes.
118.23: Yea, Thy testimonies are my delight, they are my counsellors. DALETH.
118.160: SCHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause; But my heart standeth in awe of Thy words.
118.28: Remove from me the way of falsehood; and grant me Thy law graciously.
118.29: I have chosen the way of faithfulness; Thine ordinances have I set [before me].
118.161: I rejoice at Thy word, As one that findeth great spoil.
118.0: ALEPH. Happy are they that are upright in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.
118.4: Oh that my ways were directed to observe Thy statutes!
118.8: BETH. Wherewithal shall a young man keep his way pure? By taking heed thereto according to Thy word.
118.163: Seven times a day do I praise Thee, because of Thy righteous ordinances.
118.119: My flesh shuddereth for fear of Thee; And I am afraid of Thy judgments.
118.120: AIN. I have done justice and righteousness; Leave me not to mine oppressors.
118.121: Be surety for Thy servant for good; Let not the proud oppress me.
118.122: Mine eyes fail for Thy salvation, and for Thy righteous word.
118.123: Deal with Thy servant according unto Thy mercy, and teach me Thy statutes.
118.124: I am Thy servant, give me understanding, that I may know Thy testimonies.
118.125: It is time for the LORD to work; They have made void Thy law.
118.126: Therefore I love Thy commandments Above gold, yea, above fine gold.
118.127: Therefore I esteem all [Thy] precepts concerning all things to be right; Every false way I hate.
118.128: PE. Thy testimonies are wonderful; Therefore doth my soul keep them.
118.129: The opening of Thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.
118.167: I have observed Thy precepts and Thy testimonies; For all my ways are before Thee.
118.118: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love Thy testimonies.
118.59: I made haste, and delayed not, to observe Thy commandments.
118.58: I considered my ways, and turned my feet unto Thy testimonies.
118.55: This I have had, that I have kept Thy precepts.
118.54: I have remembered Thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have observed Thy law.
118.57: I have entreated Thy favour with my whole heart; be gracious unto me according to Thy word.
118.56: HETH. My portion is the LORD, I have said that I would observe Thy words.
118.51: I have remembered Thine ordinances which are of old, O LORD, and have comforted myself. .
118.50: The proud have had me greatly in derision; yet have I not turned aside from Thy law.
118.53: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.
118.52: Burning indignation hath taken hold upon me, because of the wicked that forsake Thy law.
118.164: Great peace have they that love Thy law; And there is no stumbling for them.
118.115: Uphold me according unto Thy word, that I may live; and put me not to shame in my hope.
118.114: Depart from me, ye evildoers; that I may keep the commandments of my God.
118.88: LAMED. For ever, O LORD, Thy word standeth fast in heaven.
118.89: Thy faithfulness is unto all generations; Thou hast established the earth, and it standeth.
118.111: I have inclined my heart to perform Thy statutes, for ever, at every step.
118.110: Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever; for they are the rejoicing of my heart.
118.113: Thou art my covert and my shield; in Thy word do I hope.
118.112: SAMECH. I hate them that are of a double mind; but Thy law do I love.
118.82: For I am become like a wine-skin in the smoke; yet do I not forget Thy statutes.
118.83: How many are the days of Thy servant? When wilt Thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
118.80: CAPH. My soul pineth for Thy salvation; in Thy word do I hope.
118.81: Mine eyes fail for Thy word, Saying: 'When wilt Thou comfort me?'
118.86: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but as for me, I forsook not Thy precepts.
118.87: Quicken me after Thy lovingkindness, and I will observe the testimony of Thy mouth.
118.84: The proud have digged pits for me, which is not according to Thy law.
118.85: All Thy commandments are faithful; they persecute me for nought; help Thou me.
118.3: Thou hast ordained Thy precepts, that we should observe them diligently.
118.7: I will observe Thy statutes; O forsake me not utterly.
118.108: My soul is continually in my hand; yet have I not forgotten Thy law.
118.109: The wicked have laid a snare for me; yet went I not astray from Thy precepts.
118.102: How sweet are Thy words unto my palate! Yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
118.103: From Thy precepts I get understanding; Therefore I hate every false way.
118.100: I have refrained my feet from every evil way, in order that I might observe Thy word.
118.101: I have not turned aside from Thine ordinances; For Thou hast instructed me.
118.106: I am afflicted very much; Quicken me, O LORD, according unto Thy word.
118.107: Accept, I beseech Thee, the freewill-offerings of my mouth, O LORD, And teach me Thine ordinances.
118.104: NUN. Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, And a light unto my path.
118.105: I have sworn, and have confirmed it, To observe Thy righteous ordinances.
118.39: Behold, I have longed after Thy precepts; quicken me in Thy righteousness.
118.38: Turn away my reproach which I dread; for Thine ordinances are good.
118.33: Give me understanding, that I keep Thy law and observe it with my whole heart.
118.32: HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of Thy statutes; And I will keep it at every step.
118.31: I will run the way of Thy commandments, For Thou dost enlarge my heart.
118.30: I cleave unto Thy testimonies; O LORD, put me not to shame.
118.37: Confirm Thy word unto Thy servant, which pertaineth unto the fear of Thee.
118.36: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity, and quicken me in Thy ways.
118.35: Incline my heart unto Thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.
118.34: Make me to tread in the path of Thy commandments; for therein do I delight.
118.60: The bands of the wicked have enclosed me; but I have not forgotten Thy law.
118.61: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto Thee because of Thy righteous ordinances.
118.62: I am a companion of all them that fear Thee, and of them that observe Thy precepts.
118.63: The earth, O LORD, is full of Thy mercy; teach me Thy statutes.
118.64: TETH. Thou hast dealt well with Thy servant, O LORD, according unto Thy word.
118.65: Teach me good discernment and knowledge; for I have believed in Thy commandments.
118.66: Before I was afflicted, I did err; But now I observe Thy word.
118.67: Thou art good, and doest good; Teach me Thy statutes.
118.68: The proud have forged a lie against me; But I with my whole heart will keep Thy precepts.
118.69: Their heart is gross like fat; But I delight in Thy law.
118.175: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Thy servant; For I have not forgotten Thy commandments.
118.174: Let my soul live, and it shall praise Thee; And let Thine ordinances help me.
118.173: I have longed for Thy salvation, O LORD; And Thy law is my delight.
118.172: Let Thy hand be ready to help me; For I have chosen Thy precepts.
118.171: Let my tongue sing of Thy word; For all Thy commandments are righteousness.
118.170: Let my lips utter praise: Because Thou teachest me Thy statutes.
118.2: Yea, they do no unrighteousness; they walk in His ways.
118.162: I hate and abhor falsehood; Thy law do I love. .
118.6: I will give thanks unto Thee with uprightness of heart, when I learn Thy righteous ordinances. .
118.99: I understand more than mine elders, because I have keep Thy precepts.
118.98: I have more understanding than all my teachers; For Thy testimonies are my meditation.
118.168: TAV. Let my cry come near before Thee, O LORD; Give me understanding according to Thy word.
118.169: Let my supplication come before Thee; deliver me according to Thy word.
118.91: Unless Thy law had been my delight, I should then have perished in mine affliction.
118.90: They stand this day according to Thine ordinances; for all things are Thy servants.
118.93: I am Thine, save me; for I have sought Thy precepts.
118.92: I will never forget Thy precepts; for with them Thou hast quickened me.
118.95: I have seen an end to every purpose; but Thy commandment is exceeding broad.
118.94: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me; but I will consider Thy testimonies.
118.97: Thy commandments make me wiser than mine enemies: For they are ever with me.
118.96: MEM. O how love I Thy law! It is my meditation all the day.
118.11: Blessed art Thou, O LORD; Teach me Thy statutes.
118.10: Thy word have I laid up in my heart, that I might not sin against Thee.
118.13: I have rejoiced in the way of Thy testimonies, As much as in all riches.
118.12: With my lips have I told All the ordinances of Thy mouth.
118.15: I will delight myself in Thy statutes; I will not forget Thy word.
118.14: I will meditate in Thy precepts, And have respect unto Thy ways.
118.17: Open Thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of Thy law.
118.16: GIMEL. Deal bountifully with Thy servant that I may live, and I will observe Thy word.
118.19: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto Thine ordinances at all times.
118.18: I am a sojourner in the earth; hide not Thy commandments from me.
118.117: Thou hast made light of all them that err from Thy statutes; for their deceit is vain.
118.116: Support Thou me, and I shall be saved; and I will occupy myself with Thy statutes continually.
118.151: Of old have I known from Thy testimonies that Thou hast founded them for ever.
118.150: Thou art nigh, O LORD; and all Thy commandments are truth.
118.153: Plead Thou my cause, and redeem me; Quicken me according to Thy word.
118.152: RESH. O see mine affliction, and rescue me; For I do not forget Thy law.
118.155: Great are Thy compassions, O LORD; Quicken me as Thou art wont.
118.154: Salvation is far from the wicked; For they seek not Thy statutes.
118.157: I beheld them that were faithless, and strove with them; Because they observed not Thy word.
118.156: Many are my persecutors and mine adversaries; Yet have I not turned aside from Thy testimonies.
118.159: The beginning of Thy word is truth; And all Thy righteous ordinance endureth for ever.
118.158: O see how I love Thy precepts; Quicken me, O LORD, according to Thy lovingkindness.
118.48: ZAIN. Remember the word unto Thy servant, Because Thou hast made me to hope.
118.49: This is my comfort in my affliction, that Thy word hath quickened me.
118.46: And I will delight myself in Thy commandments, which I have loved.
118.47: I will lift up my hands also unto Thy commandments, which I have loved; And I will meditate in Thy statutes.
118.44: And I will walk at ease, for I have sought Thy precepts;
118.45: I will also speak of Thy testimonies before kings, and will not be ashamed.
118.42: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I hope in Thine ordinances;
118.43: So shall I observe Thy law continually for ever and ever;
118.40: VAV. Let Thy mercies also come unto me, O LORD, even Thy salvation, according to Thy word;
118.41: That I may have an answer for him that taunteth me; for I trust in Thy word.
118.1: Happy are they that keep His testimonies, that seek Him with the whole heart.
118.5: Then should I not be ashamed, when I have regard unto all Thy commandments.
118.9: With my whole heart have I sought Thee; O let me not err from Thy commandments.
118.146: I rose early at dawn, and cried; I hoped in Thy word.
118.147: Mine eyes forestalled the night-watches, that I might meditate in Thy word.
118.144: KOPH. I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O LORD; I will keep Thy statutes.
118.145: I have called Thee, save me, and I will observe Thy testimonies.
118.142: Trouble and anguish have overtaken me; yet Thy commandments are my delight.
118.143: Thy testimonies are righteous for ever; give me understanding, and I shall live.
118.140: I am small and despised; yet have I not forgotten Thy precepts.
118.141: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and Thy law is truth.
118.148: Hear my voice according unto Thy lovingkindness; Quicken me, O LORD, as Thou art wont.
118.149: They draw nigh that follow after wickedness; they are far from Thy law.
118.77: Let the proud be put to shame, for they have distorted my cause with falsehood; but I will meditate in Thy precepts.
118.76: Let Thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live; for Thy law is my delight.
118.75: Let, I pray Thee, Thy lovingkindness be ready to comfort me, According to Thy promise unto Thy servant.
118.74: I know, O LORD, that Thy judgments are righteous, and that in faithfulness Thou hast afflicted me. .
118.73: They that fear Thee shall see me and be glad, because I have hope in Thy word.
118.72: JOD. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me; Give me understanding, that I may learn Thy commandments.
118.71: The law of Thy mouth is better unto me Than thousands of gold and silver.
118.70: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, In order that I might learn Thy statutes.
118.79: Let my heart be undivided in Thy statutes, in order that I may not be put to shame.
118.78: Let those that fear Thee return unto me, and they that know Thy testimonies.

59.11: Hast not Thou, O God, cast us off? And Thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts.
59.10: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me unto Edom?
59.13: Through God we shall do valiantly; For He it is that will tread down our adversaries.
59.12: Give us help against the adversary; For vain is the help of man.
59.1: when he strove with Aram-naharaim and with Aram-zobah, and Joab returned, and smote of Edom in the Valley of Salt twelve thousand.
59.0: For the Leader; upon Shushan Eduth; Michtam of David, to teach;
59.3: Thou hast made the land to shake, Thou hast cleft it; Heal the breaches thereof; for it tottereth.
59.2: O God, Thou hast cast us off, Thou hast broken us down; Thou hast been angry; O restore us.
59.5: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear Thee, That it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah
59.4: Thou hast made Thy people to see hard things; Thou hast made us to drink the wine of staggering.
59.7: God spoke in His holiness, that I would exult; That I would divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
59.6: That Thy beloved may be delivered, Save with Thy right hand, and answer me.
59.9: Moab is my washpot; Upon Edom do I cast my shoe; Philistia, cry aloud because of me!
59.8: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre.

58.11: Slay them not, lest my people forget, make them wander to and fro by Thy power, and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
58.10: The God of my mercy will come to meet me; God will let me gaze upon mine adversaries.
58.13: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they be no more; and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob, unto the ends of the earth. Selah
58.12: For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips, let them even be taken in their pride, and for cursing and lying which they speak.
58.15: They wander up and down to devour, and tarry all night if they have not their fill.
58.14: And they return at evening, they howl like a dog, and go round about the city;
58.17: O my strength, unto Thee will I sing praises; for God is my high tower, the God of my mercy.
58.16: But as for me, I will sing of Thy strength; yea, I will sing aloud of Thy mercy in the morning; for Thou hast been my high tower, and a refuge in the day of my distress.
58.1: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God; set me on high from them that rise up against me.
58.0: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.
58.3: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul; the impudent gather themselves together against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.
58.2: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from the men of blood.
58.5: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, arouse Thyself to punish all the nations; show no mercy to any iniquitous traitors. Selah
58.4: Without my fault, they run and prepare themselves; awake Thou to help me, and behold.
58.7: Behold, they belch out with their mouth; swords are in their lips: 'For who doth hear?'
58.6: They return at evening, they howl like a dog, and go round about the city.
58.9: Because of his strength, I will wait for Thee; for God is my high tower.
58.8: But Thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; Thou shalt have all the nations in derision.

55.11: In God do I trust, I will not be afraid; What can man do unto me?
55.10: In God—I will praise His word— In the LORD—I will praise His word—
55.13: For thou hast delivered my soul from death; Hast Thou not delivered my feet from stumbling? That I may walk before God in the light of the living?
55.12: Thy vows are upon me, O God; I will render thank-offerings unto Thee.
55.1: Be gracious unto me, O God, for man would swallow me up; All the day he fighting oppresseth me.
55.0: For the Leader; upon Jonath-elem-rehokim. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam; when the Philistines took him in Gath. .
55.3: In the day that I am afraid, I will put my trust in Thee.
55.2: They that lie in wait for me would swallow me up all the day; For they are many that fight against me, O Most High,
55.5: All the day they trouble mine affairs; All their thoughts are against me for evil.
55.4: In God—I will praise His word— In God do I trust, I will not be afraid; What can flesh do unto me?
55.7: Because of iniquity cast them out; In anger bring down the peoples, O God.
55.6: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, They mark my steps; According as they have waited for my soul.
55.9: Then shall mine enemies turn back in the day that I call; This I know, that God is for me.
55.8: Thou has counted my wanderings; Put Thou my tears into Thy bottle; Are they not in Thy book?

54.20: He hath put forth his hands against them that were at peace with him; He hath profaned his covenant.
54.21: Smoother than cream were the speeches of his mouth, But his heart was war; His words were softer than oil, Yet were they keen-edged swords.
54.22: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and He will sustain thee; He will never suffer the righteous to be moved.
54.23: But Thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the nethermost pit; Men of blood and deceit shall not live out half their days; But as for me, I will trust in Thee.
54.1: Give ear, O God, to my prayer; And hide not Thyself from my supplication.
54.0: For the Leader; with string-music. Maschil of David.
54.3: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked; For they cast mischief upon me, and in anger they persecute me.
54.2: Attend unto me, and hear me; I am distraught in my complaint, and will moan;
54.5: Fear and trembling come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
54.4: My heart doth writhe within me; and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
54.7: Lo, then would I wander far off, I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah
54.6: And I said: 'Oh that I had wings like a dove! Then would I fly away, and be at rest.
54.9: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongue; For I have seen violence and strife in the city.
54.8: I would haste me to a shelter from the stormy wind and tempest.'
54.11: Wickedness is in the midst thereof; oppression and guile depart not from her broad place.
54.10: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof; iniquity also and mischief are in the midst of it.
54.13: But it was thou, a man mine equal, My companion, and my familiar friend;
54.12: For it was not an enemy that taunted me, Then I could have borne it; Neither was it mine adversary that did magnify himself against me, Then I would have hid myself from him.
54.15: May He incite death against them, Let them go down alive into the nether-world; For evil is in their dwelling, and within them.
54.14: We took sweet counsel together, In the house of God we walked with the throng.
54.17: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I complain, and moan; And He hath heard my voice.
54.16: As for me, I will call upon God; And the LORD shall save me.
54.19: God shall hear, and humble them, even He that is enthroned of old, Selah, such as have no changes, and fear not God.
54.18: He hath redeemed my soul in peace so that none came nigh me; For they were many that strove with me.

57.11: And men shall say: 'Verily there is a reward for the righteous; Verily there is a God that judgeth in the earth.'
57.10: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
57.1: Do ye indeed speak as a righteous company? Do ye judge with equity the sons of men?
57.0: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam.
57.3: The wicked are estranged from the womb; The speakers of lies go astray as soon as they are born.
57.2: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; Ye weigh out in the earth the violence of your hands.
57.5: Which hearkeneth not to the voice of charmers, Or of the most cunning binder of spells.
57.4: Their venom is like the venom of a serpent; They are like the deaf asp that stoppeth her ear;
57.7: Let them melt away as water that runneth apace; When he aimeth his arrows, let them be as though they were cut off.
57.6: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth; Break out the cheek-teeth of the young lions, O LORD.
57.9: Before your pots can feel the thorns, He will sweep it away with a whirlwind, the raw and the burning alike.
57.8: Let them be as a snail which melteth and passeth away; Like the untimely births of a woman, that have not seen the sun.

56.11: Be Thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; Thy glory be above all the earth.
56.10: For Thy mercy is great unto the heavens, And Thy truth unto the skies.
56.1: Be gracious unto me, O God, be gracious unto me, for in Thee hath my soul taken refuge; yea, in the shadow of Thy wings will I take refuge, until calamities be overpast.
56.0: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam; when he fled from Saul, in the cave.
56.3: He will send from heaven, and save me, when he that would swallow me up taunteth, Selah; God shall send forth His mercy and His truth.
56.2: I will cry unto God Most high; unto God that accomplisheth it for me.
56.5: Be Thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; Thy glory be above all the earth.
56.4: My soul is among lions, I do lie down among them that are aflame; Even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
56.7: My heart is stedfast, O God, my heart is stedfast; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises.
56.6: They have prepared a net for my steps, My soul is bowed down; They have digged a pit before me, They are fallen into the midst thereof themselves. Selah
56.9: I will give thanks unto Thee, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing praises unto Thee among the nations.
56.8: Awake, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp; I will awake the dawn.

51.10: I will give Thee thanks for ever, because Thou hast done it; And I will wait for Thy name, for it is good, in the presence of Thy saints.
51.1: when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said unto him: 'David is come to the house of Ahimelech.'
51.0: For the Leader. Maschil of David;
51.3: Thy tongue deviseth destruction; Like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
51.2: Why boastest thou thyself of evil, O mighty man? The mercy of God endureth continually.
51.5: Thou lovest all devouring words, The deceitful tongue.
51.4: Thou lovest evil more than good; Falsehood rather than speaking righteousness. Selah
51.7: The righteous also shall see, and fear, And shall laugh at him:
51.6: God will likewise break thee for ever, He will take thee up, and pluck thee out of thy tent, And root thee out of the land of the living. Selah
51.9: But as for me, I am like a leafy olive-tree in the house of God; I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
51.8: 'Lo, this is the man that made not God his stronghold; But trusted in the abundance of his riches, And strengthened himself in his wickedness.'

50.11: Create me a clean heart, O God; and renew a stedfast spirit within me.
50.10: Hide Thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
50.13: Restore unto me the joy of Thy salvation; and let a willing spirit uphold me.
50.12: Cast me not away from Thy presence; and take not Thy holy spirit from me.
50.15: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, Thou God of my salvation; so shall my tongue sing aloud of Thy righteousness.
50.14: Then will I teach transgressors Thy ways; and sinners shall return unto Thee. .
50.17: For Thou delightest not in sacrifice, else would I give it; Thou hast no pleasure in burnt-offering.
50.16: O Lord, open Thou my lips; and my mouth shall declare Thy praise.
50.19: Do good in Thy favour unto Zion; build Thou the walls of Jerusalem.
50.18: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and a contrite heart, O God, Thou wilt not despise.
50.20: Then wilt Thou delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, in burnt-offering and whole offering; Then will they offer bullocks upon Thine altar.
50.1: when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.
50.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David;
50.3: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, And cleanse me from my sin.
50.2: Be gracious unto me, O God, according to Thy mercy; According to the multitude of Thy compassions blot out my transgressions.
50.5: Against Thee, Thee only, have I sinned, And done that which is evil in Thy sight; That Thou mayest be justified when Thou speakest, And be in the right when Thou judgest.
50.4: For I know my transgressions; And my sin is ever before me.
50.7: Behold, Thou desirest truth in the inward parts; make me, therefore, to know wisdom in mine inmost heart.
50.6: Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity, and in sin did my mother conceive me.
50.9: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which Thou hast crushed may rejoice.
50.8: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

53.1: when the Ziphites came and said to Saul: 'Doth not David hide himself with us?'
53.0: For the Leader; with string-music. Maschil of David:
53.3: O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.
53.2: O God, save me by Thy name, And right me by Thy might.
53.5: Behold, God is my helper; The Lord is for me as the upholder of my soul.
53.4: For strangers are risen up against me, And violent men have sought after my soul; They have not set God before them. Selah
53.7: With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto Thee; I will give thanks unto Thy name, O LORD, for it is good.
53.6: He will requite the evil unto them that lie in wait for me; Destroy Thou them in Thy truth.
53.8: For He hath delivered me out of all trouble; And mine eye hath gazed upon mine enemies.

52.1: The fool hath said in his heart: 'There is no God'; They have dealt corruptly, and have done abominable iniquity; There is none that doeth good.
52.0: For the Leader; upon Mahalath. Maschil of David.
52.3: Every one of them is unclean, they are together become impure; There is none that doeth good, no, not one.
52.2: God looked forth from heaven upon the children of men, To see if there were any man of understanding, that did seek after God.
52.5: There are they in great fear, where no fear was; For God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee; Thou hast put them to shame, because God hath rejected them.
52.4: ’Shall not the workers of iniquity know it, Who eat up My people as they eat bread, And call not upon God?'
52.6: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When God turneth the captivity of His people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

115.11: How can I repay unto the LORD All His bountiful dealings toward me?
115.10: I said in my haste: 'All men are liars.'
115.13: My vows will I pay unto the LORD, Yea, in the presence of all His people.
115.12: I will lift up the cup of salvation, And call upon the name of the LORD.
115.15: I beseech Thee, O LORD, for I am Thy servant; I am Thy servant, the son of Thy handmaid; Thou hast loosed my bands.
115.14: Precious in the sight of the LORD Is the death of His saints.
115.17: I will pay my vows unto the LORD, Yea, in the presence of all His people;
115.16: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, And will call upon the name of the LORD.
115.18: In the courts of the LORD’S house, In the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Hallelujah.
115.1: Because He hath inclined His ear unto me, Therefore will I call upon Him all my days.
115.0: I love that the LORD should hear my voice and my supplications.
115.3: But I called upon the name of the LORD: 'I beseech thee, O LORD, deliver my soul.'
115.2: The cords of death compassed me, And the straits of the nether-world got hold upon me; I found trouble and sorrow.
115.5: The LORD preserveth the simple; I was brought low, and He saved me.
115.4: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; Yea, our God is compassionate.
115.7: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, Mine eyes from tears, And my feet from stumbling.
115.6: Return, O my soul, unto Thy rest; For the LORD hath dealt bountifully with thee.
115.9: I trusted even when I spoke: 'I am greatly afflicted.'
115.8: I shall walk before the LORD In the lands of the living.

114.11: The LORD hath been mindful of us, He will bless— He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron.
114.10: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their help and their shield.
114.13: The LORD increase you more and more, You and your children.
114.12: He will bless them that fear the LORD, Both small and great.
114.15: The heavens are the heavens of the LORD; But the earth hath He given to the children of men.
114.14: Blessed be ye of the LORD Who made heaven and earth.
114.17: But we will bless the LORD From this time forth and for ever. Hallelujah.
114.16: The dead praise not the LORD, Neither any that go down into silence;
114.1: Wherefore should the nations say: 'Where is now their God?'
114.0: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, But unto Thy name give glory, For Thy mercy, and for Thy truth's sake.
114.3: Their idols are silver and gold, The work of men's hands.
114.2: But our God is in the heavens; Whatsoever pleased Him He hath done.
114.5: They have ears, but they hear not; Noses have they, but they smell not;
114.4: They have mouths, but they speak not; Eyes have they, but they see not;
114.7: They that make them shall be like unto them; Yea, every one that trusteth in them.
114.6: They have hands, but they handle not; Feet have they, but they walk not; Neither speak they with their throat. .
114.9: O house of Aaron, trust ye in the LORD! He is their help and their shield!
114.8: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD! He is their help and their shield!

88.42: Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries; Thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
88.48: What man is he that liveth and shall not see death, That shall deliver his soul from the power of the grave? Selah
88.43: Yea, Thou turnest back the edge of his sword, And hast not made him to stand in the battle.
88.49: Where are Thy former mercies, O Lord, Which Thou didst swear unto David in Thy faithfulness?
88.52: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
88.24: But My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with him; And through My name shall his horn be exalted.
88.25: I will set his hand also on the sea, And his right hand on the rivers.
88.26: He shall call unto Me: Thou art my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation. .
88.27: I also will appoint him first-born, The highest of the kings of the earth.
88.20: I have found David My servant; With My holy oil have I anointed him;
88.21: With whom My hand shall be established; Mine arm also shall strengthen him.
88.22: The enemy shall not exact from him; Nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
88.23: And I will beat to pieces his adversaries before him, And smite them that hate him.
88.46: How long, O LORD, wilt Thou hide Thyself for ever? How long shall Thy wrath burn like fire?
88.47: O remember how short my time is; For what vanity hast Thou created all the children of men!
88.44: Thou hast made his brightness to cease, And cast his throne down to the ground.
88.45: The days of his youth hast Thou shortened; Thou hast covered him with shame. Selah
88.28: For ever will I keep for him My mercy, And My covenant shall stand fast with him.
88.29: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, And his throne as the days of heaven.
88.40: Thou hast broken down all his fences; Thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.
88.41: All that pass by the way spoil him; He is become a taunt to his neighbours.
88.1: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever; To all generations will I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth.
88.3: I have made a covenant with My chosen, I have sworn unto David My servant:
88.2: For I have said: 'For ever is mercy built; In the very heavens Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness.
88.5: So shall the heavens praise Thy wonders, O LORD, Thy faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
88.4: For ever will I establish thy seed, And build up thy throne to all generations.' Selah
88.7: A God dreaded in the great council of the holy ones, And feared of all them that are about Him?
88.6: For who in the skies can be compared unto the LORD, Who among the sons of might can be likened unto the LORD,
88.9: Thou rulest the proud swelling of the sea; When the waves thereof arise, Thou stillest them.
88.8: O LORD God of hosts, Who is a mighty one, like unto Thee, O LORD? And Thy faithfulness is round about Thee.
88.51: Wherewith Thine enemies have taunted, O LORD, Wherewith they have taunted the footsteps of Thine anointed.
88.39: Thou hast abhorred the covenant of Thy servant; Thou hast profaned his crown even to the ground.
88.38: But Thou hast cast off and rejected, Thou hast been wroth with Thine anointed.
88.11: Thine are the heavens, Thine also the earth; The world and the fulness thereof, Thou hast founded them.
88.10: Thou didst crush Rahab, as one that is slain; Thou didst scattered Thine enemies with the arm of Thy strength.
88.13: Thine is an arm with might; Strong is Thy hand, and exalted is Thy right hand.
88.12: The north and the south, Thou hast created them; Tabor and Hermon rejoice in Thy name.
88.15: Happy is the people that know the joyful shout; They walk, O LORD, in the light of Thy countenance.
88.14: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Thy throne; Mercy and truth go before Thee.
88.17: For Thou art the glory of their strength; And in Thy favour our horn is exalted.
88.16: In Thy name do they rejoice all the day; And through Thy righteousness are they exalted.
88.19: Then Thou spokest in vision to Thy godly ones, And saidst: 'I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
88.18: For of the LORD is our shield; And the Holy One of Israel is our king.
88.31: If they profane My statutes, And keep not My commandments;
88.30: If his children forsake My law, And walk not in Mine ordinances; :
88.37: It shall be established for ever as the moon; And be stedfast as the witness in sky.' Selah
88.36: His seed shall endure for ever, And his throne as the sun before Me.
88.35: Once have I sworn by My holiness: Surely I will not be false unto David;
88.34: My covenant will I not profane, Nor alter that which is gone out of My lips.
88.33: But My mercy will I not break off from him, Nor will I be false to My faithfulness.
88.32: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, And their iniquity with strokes.
88.50: Remember, Lord, the taunt of Thy servants; How I do bear in my bosom [the taunt of] so many peoples;

89.11: So teach us to number our days, That we may get us a heart of wisdom.
89.10: Who knoweth the power of Thine anger, And Thy wrath according to the fear that is due unto Thee?
89.13: O satisfy us in the morning with Thy mercy; That we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
89.12: Return, O LORD; how long? And let it repent Thee concerning Thy servants.
89.15: Let Thy work appear unto Thy servants, And Thy glory upon their children.
89.14: Make us glad according to the days wherein Thou hast afflicted us, According to the years wherein we have seen evil.
89.16: And let the graciousness of the Lord our God be upon us; Establish Thou also upon us the work of our hands; Yea, the work of our hands establish Thou it.
89.1: Before the mountains were brought forth, Or ever Thou hadst formed the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, Thou art God.
89.0: A Prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, Thou hast been our dwelling-place in all generations.
89.3: For a thousand years in Thy sight Are but as yesterday when it is past, And as a watch in the night.
89.2: Thou turnest man to contrition; And sayest: 'Return, ye children of men.'
89.5: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; In the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
89.4: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep; In the morning they are like grass which groweth up.
89.7: Thou hast set our iniquities before Thee, Our secret sins in the light of Thy countenance.
89.6: For we are consumed in Thine anger, And by Thy wrath are we hurried away.
89.9: The days of our years are threescore years and ten, Or even by reason of strength fourscore years; Yet is their pride but travail and vanity; For it is speedily gone, and we fly away.
89.8: For all our days are passed away in Thy wrath; We bring our years to an end as a tale that is told.

111.1: His seed shall be mighty upon earth; The generation of the upright shall be blessed.
111.0: Hallelujah. Happy is the man that feareth the LORD, That delighteth greatly in His commandments.
111.3: Unto the upright He shineth as a light in the darkness, Gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
111.2: Wealth and riches are in his house; And his merit endureth for ever.
111.5: For he shall never be moved; The righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.
111.4: Well is it with the man that dealeth graciously and lendeth, That ordereth his affairs rightfully.
111.7: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, Until he gaze upon his adversaries.
111.6: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; His heart is stedfast, trusting in the LORD.
111.9: The wicked shall see it, and be vexed; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away; the desire of the wicked shall perish.
111.8: He hath scattered abroad, he hath given to the needy; His righteousness endureth for ever; His horn shall be exalted in honour.

110.1: The works of the LORD are great, Sought out of all them that have delight therein.
110.0: Hallelujah. I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart, . In the council of the upright, and in the congregation.
110.3: He hath made a memorial for His wonderful works; The LORD is gracious and full of compassion.
110.2: His work is glory and majesty; And His righteousness endureth for ever.
110.5: He hath declared to His people the power of His works, In giving them the heritage of the nations.
110.4: He hath given food unto them that fear Him; He will ever be mindful of His covenant.
110.7: They are established for ever and ever, They are done in truth and uprightness.
110.6: The works of His hands are truth and justice; All His precepts are sure.
110.9: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; A good understanding have all they that do thereafter; His praise endureth for ever.
110.8: He hath sent redemption unto His people; He hath commanded His covenant for ever; Holy and awful is His name.

113.1: Judah became His sanctuary, Israel His dominion.
113.0: When Israel came forth out of Egypt, The house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
113.3: The mountains skipped like rams, The hills like young sheep.
113.2: The sea saw it, and fled; The Jordan turned backward.
113.5: Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams; Ye hills, like young sheep?
113.4: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleest? Thou Jordan, that thou turnest backward?
113.7: Who turned the rock into a pool of water, The flint into a fountain of waters.
113.6: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, At the presence of the God of Jacob;
