112.1: Blessed be the name of the LORD From this time forth and for ever.
112.0: Hallelujah. Praise, O ye servants of the LORD, Praise the name of the LORD.
112.3: The LORD is high above all nations, His glory is above the heavens.
112.2: From the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof The LORD'S name is to be praised.
112.5: That looketh down low Upon heaven and upon the earth?
112.4: Who is like unto the LORD our God, That is enthroned on high,
112.7: That He may set him with princes, Even with the princes of His people.
112.6: Who raiseth up the poor out of the dust, And lifteth up the needy out of the dunghill;
112.8: Who maketh the barren woman to dwell in her house As a joyful mother of children. Hallelujah.

82.11: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, And like Zebah and Zalmunna all their princes;
82.10: Who were destroyed at En-dor; They became as dung for the earth.
82.13: O my God, make them like the whirling dust; As stubble before the wind.
82.12: Who said: 'Let us take to ourselves in possession The habitations of God.'
82.15: So pursue them with Thy tempest, And affright them with Thy storm.
82.14: As the fire that burneth the forest, And as the flame that setteth the mountains ablaze;
82.17: Let them be ashamed and affrighted for ever; Yea, let them be abashed and perish;
82.16: Fill their faces with shame; That they may seek Thy name, O LORD.
82.18: That they may know that it is Thou alone whose name is the LORD, The Most High over all the earth.
82.1: O God, keep not Thou silence; Hold not Thy peace, and be not still, O God.
82.0: A Song, a Psalm of Asaph.
82.3: They hold crafty converse against Thy people, And take counsel against Thy treasured ones.
82.2: For, lo, Thine enemies are in an uproar; And they that hate Thee have lifted up the head.
82.5: For they have consulted together with one consent; Against Thee do they make a covenant;
82.4: They have said: 'Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; That the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.'
82.7: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
82.6: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab, and the Hagrites;
82.9: Do Thou unto them as unto Midian; As to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook Kishon;
82.8: Assyria also is joined with them; They have been an arm to the children of Lot. Selah

83.11: For the LORD God is a sun and a shield; the LORD giveth grace and glory; No good thing will He withhold from them that walk uprightly.
83.10: For a day in Thy courts is better than a thousand; I had rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
83.12: O LORD of hosts, happy is the man that trusteth in Thee.
83.1: How lovely are Thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!
83.0: For the Leader; upon the Gittith. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
83.3: Yea, the sparrow hath found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, Where she may lay her young; Thine altars, O LORD of hosts, My King, and my God—
83.2: My soul yearneth, yea, even pineth for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh sing for joy unto the living God.
83.5: Happy is the man whose strength is in Thee; in whose heart are the highways.
83.4: Happy are they that dwell in Thy house, they are ever praising Thee. Selah
83.7: They go from strength to strength, every one of them appeareth before God in Zion.
83.6: Passing through the valley of Baca they make it a place of springs; yea, the early rain clotheth it with blessings.
83.9: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of Thine anointed.
83.8: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah

80.11: But My people hearkened not to My voice; And Israel would none of Me.
80.10: I am the LORD thy God, who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt; open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
80.13: Oh that My people would hearken unto Me, That Israel would walk in My ways!
80.12: So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart, That they might walk in their own counsels.
80.15: The haters of the LORD should dwindle away before Him; And their punishment should endure for ever.
80.14: I would soon subdue their enemies, And turn My hand against their adversaries.
80.16: They should also be fed with the fat of wheat; and with honey out of the rock would I satisfy thee.'
80.1: Sing aloud unto God our strength; shout unto the God of Jacob.
80.0: For the Leader; upon the Gittith. [A Psalm] of Asaph.
80.3: Blow the horn at the new moon, at the full moon for our feast-day.
80.2: Take up the melody, and sound the timbrel, the sweet harp with the psaltery.
80.5: He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony, when He went forth against the land of Egypt. The speech of one that I knew not did I hear:
80.4: For it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
80.7: Thou didst call in trouble, and I rescued thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah
80.6: 'I removed his shoulder from the burden; His hands were freed from the basket.
80.9: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any foreign god.
80.8: Hear, O My people, and I will admonish thee: O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto Me!

81.1: 'How long will ye judge unjustly, and respect the persons of the wicked? Selah
81.0: A Psalm of Asaph. God standeth in the congregation of God; in the midst of the judges He judgeth:
81.3: Rescue the poor and needy; deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.
81.2: Judge the poor and fatherless; do justice to the afflicted and destitute.
81.5: I said: Ye are godlike beings, and all of you sons of the Most High.
81.4: They know not, neither do they understand; they go about in darkness; all the foundations of the earth are moved.
81.7: Arise, O God, judge the earth; for Thou shalt possess all the nations.
81.6: Nevertheless ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.'

86.1: The LORD loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
86.0: A Psalm of the sons of Korah; a Song. His foundation is in the holy mountains.
86.3: 'I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among them that know Me; behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this one was born there.'
86.2: Glorious things are spoken of Thee, O city of God. Selah
86.5: The LORD shall count in the register of the peoples: 'This one was born there.' Selah
86.4: But of Zion it shall be said: 'This man and that was born in her; And the Most High Himself doth establish her.'
86.6: And whether they sing or dance, all my thoughts are in Thee.

87.11: Shall Thy mercy be declared in the grave? Or Thy faithfulness in destruction?
87.10: Wilt Thou work wonders for the dead? Or shall the shades arise and give Thee thanks? Selah
87.13: But as for me, unto Thee, O LORD, do I cry, And in the morning doth my prayer come to meet Thee.
87.12: Shall Thy wonders be known in the dark? And Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
87.15: I am afflicted and at the point of death from my youth up; I have borne Thy terrors, I am distracted.
87.14: LORD, why castest Thou off my soul? Why hidest Thou Thy face from me?
87.17: They came round about me like water all the day; They compassed me about together.
87.16: Thy fierce wrath is gone over me; Thy terrors have cut me off.
87.18: Friend and companion hast Thou put far from me, And mine acquaintance into darkness.
87.1: O LORD, God of my salvation, What time I cry in the night before Thee,
87.0: A Song, a Psalm of the sons of Korah; for the Leader; upon Mahalath Leannoth. Maschil of Heman the Ezrahite.
87.3: For my soul is sated with troubles, And my life draweth nigh unto the grave.
87.2: Let my prayer come before Thee, Incline Thine ear unto my cry.
87.5: Set apart among the dead, Like the slain that lie in the grave, Whom Thou rememberest no more; And they are cut off from Thy hand. .
87.4: I am counted with them that go down into the pit; I am become as a man that hath no help;
87.7: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, And all Thy waves Thou pressest down. Selah
87.6: Thou hast laid me in the nether-most pit, In dark places, in the deeps.
87.9: Mine eye languisheth by reason of affliction; I have called upon Thee, O LORD, every day, I have spread forth my hands unto Thee.
87.8: Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me; Thou hast made me an abomination unto them; I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

84.11: Truth springeth out of the earth; And righteousness hath looked down from heaven.
84.10: Mercy and truth are met together; Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
84.13: Righteousness shall go before Him, And shall make His footsteps a way.
84.12: Yea, the LORD will give that which is good; And our land shall yield her produce.
84.1: LORD, Thou hast been favourable unto Thy land, Thou hast turned the captivity of Jacob.
84.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
84.3: Thou hast withdrawn all Thy wrath; Thou hast turned from the fierceness of Thine anger.
84.2: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of Thy people, Thou hast pardoned all their sin. Selah .
84.5: Wilt Thou be angry with us for ever? Wilt Thou draw out Thine anger to all generations?
84.4: Restore us, O God of our salvation, And cause Thine indignation toward us to cease.
84.7: Show us Thy mercy, O LORD, And grant us Thy salvation.
84.6: Wilt Thou not quicken us again, That Thy people may rejoice in Thee?
84.9: Surely His salvation is nigh them that fear Him; That glory may dwell in our land.
84.8: I will hear what God the LORD will speak; For He will speak peace unto His people, and to His saints; But let them not turn back to folly.

85.11: I will thank Thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart; And I will glorify Thy name for evermore.
85.10: Teach me, O LORD, Thy way, that I may walk in Thy truth; Make one my heart to fear Thy name. .
85.13: O God, the proud are risen up against me, And the company of violent men have sought after my soul, And have not set Thee before them.
85.12: For great is Thy mercy toward me; And Thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest nether-world.
85.15: O turn unto me, and be gracious unto me; Give Thy strength unto Thy servant, And save the son of Thy handmaid.
85.14: But Thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion and gracious, Slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy and truth.
85.16: Work in my behalf a sign for good; That they that hate me may see it, and be put to shame, Because Thou, LORD, hast helped me, and comforted me.
85.1: Keep my soul, for I am godly; O Thou my God, save Thy servant that trusteth in Thee.
85.0: A Prayer of David. Incline Thine ear, O LORD, and answer me; For I am poor and needy.
85.3: Rejoice the soul of Thy servant; For unto Thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
85.2: Be gracious unto me, O Lord; For unto Thee do I cry all the day.
85.5: Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer; And attend unto the voice of my supplications.
85.4: For Thou, Lord, art good, and ready to pardon, And plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon Thee.
85.7: There is none like unto Thee among the gods, O Lord, And there are no works like Thine.
85.6: In the day of my trouble I call upon Thee; For Thou wilt answer me.
85.9: For Thou art great, and doest wondrous things; Thou art God alone.
85.8: All nations whom Thou hast made shall come and prostrate themselves before Thee, O Lord; And they shall glorify Thy name.

3.1: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness, Thou who didst set me free when I was in distress; be gracious unto me, and hear my prayer.
3.0: For the Leader; with string-music. A Psalm of David.
3.3: But know that the LORD hath set apart the godly man as His own; The LORD will hear when I call unto Him.
3.2: O ye sons of men, how long shall my glory be put to shame, in that ye love vanity, and seek after falsehood? Selah
3.5: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
3.4: Tremble, and sin not; commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah
3.7: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than when their corn and their wine increase.
3.6: Many there are that say: 'Oh that we could see some good!' LORD, lift Thou up the light of Thy countenance upon us.
3.8: In peace will I both lay me down and sleep; for Thou, LORD, makest me dwell alone in safety.

7.1: O LORD, our Lord, How glorious is Thy name in all the earth! Whose majesty is rehearsed above the heavens.
7.0: For the Leader; upon the Gittith. A Psalm of David.
7.3: When I behold Thy heavens, the work of Thy fingers, The moon and the stars, which Thou hast established;
7.2: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast Thou founded strength, Because of Thine adversaries; That Thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
7.5: Yet Thou hast made him but little lower than the angels, And hast crowned him with glory and honour.
7.4: What is man, that Thou art mindful of him? And the son of man, that Thou thinkest of him?
7.7: Sheep and oxen, all of them, Yea, and the beasts of the field;
7.6: Thou hast made him to have dominion over the works of Thy hands; Thou hast put all things under His feet:
7.9: O LORD, our Lord, How glorious is Thy name in all the earth!
7.8: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea; Whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.

108.24: I am become also a taunt unto them; When they see me, they shake their head.
108.25: Help me, O LORD my God; O save me according to Thy mercy;
108.26: That they may know that this is Thy hand; That Thou, LORD, hast done it.
108.27: Let them curse, but bless Thou; When they arise, they shall be put to shame, but Thy servant shall rejoice.
108.20: But Thou, O GOD the Lord, deal with me for Thy name's sake; Because Thy mercy is good, deliver Thou me.
108.21: For I am poor and needy, And my heart is wounded within me.
108.22: I am gone like the shadow when it lengtheneth; I am shaken off as the locust.
108.23: My knees totter through fasting; And my flesh is lean, and hath no fatness.
108.28: Mine adversaries shall be clothed with confusion, And shall put on their own shame as a robe.
108.29: I will give great thanks unto the LORD with my mouth; Yea, I will praise Him among the multitude;
108.1: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit have they opened against me; They have spoken unto me with a lying tongue.
108.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David. O God of my praise, keep not silence;
108.3: In return for my love they are my adversaries; But I am all prayer.
108.2: They compassed me about also with words of hatred, And fought against me without a cause.
108.5: ’Set Thou a wicked man over him; And let an adversary stand at his right hand.
108.4: And they have laid upon me evil for good, And hatred for my love:
108.7: Let his days be few; Let another take his charge.
108.6: When he is judged, let him go forth condemned; And let his prayer be turned into sin.
108.9: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg; And let them seek their bread out of their desolate places.
108.8: Let his children be fatherless, And his wife a widow.
108.11: Let there be none to extend kindness unto him; Neither let there be any to be gracious unto his fatherless children.
108.10: Let the creditor distrain all that he hath; And let strangers make spoil of his labour.
108.13: Let the iniquity of his fathers be brought to remembrance unto the LORD; And let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
108.12: Let his posterity be cut off; In the generation following let their name be blotted out.
108.15: Because that he remembered not to do kindness, But persecuted the poor and needy man, And the broken in heart he was ready to slay.
108.14: Let them be before the LORD continually, That He may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
108.17: He clothed himself also with cursing as with his raiment, And it is come into his inward parts like water, And like oil into his bones.
108.16: Yea, he loved cursing, and it came unto him; And he delighted not in blessing, and it is far from him.
108.19: This would mine adversaries effect from the LORD, And they that speak evil against my soul.
108.18: Let it be unto him as the garment which he putteth on, And for the girdle wherewith he is girded continually.'
108.30: Because He standeth at the right hand of the needy, To save him from them that judge his soul.

109.1: The rod of Thy strength the LORD will send out of Zion: 'Rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.'
109.0: A Psalm of David. The LORD saith unto my lord: ‘Sit thou at My right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.'
109.3: The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent: 'Thou art a priest for ever After the manner of Melchizedek.'
109.2: Thy people offer themselves willingly in the day of thy warfare; in adornments of holiness, from the womb of the dawn, Thine is the dew of thy youth.
109.5: He will judge among the nations; He filleth it with the dead bodies, He crusheth the head over a wide land.
109.4: The Lord at thy right hand Doth crush kings in the day of His wrath.
109.6: He will drink of the brook in the way; Therefore will he lift up the head.

102.20: Bless the LORD, all ye His hosts; Ye ministers of His, that do His pleasure.
102.21: Bless the LORD, all ye His works, In all places of His dominion; Bless the LORD, O my soul.
102.1: Bless the LORD, O my soul, And forget not all His benefits;
102.0: [A Psalm] of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul; And all that is within me, bless His holy name.
102.3: Who redeemeth Thy life from the pit; Who encompasseth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
102.2: Who forgiveth all thine iniquity; Who healeth all Thy diseases;
102.5: The LORD executeth righteousness, And acts of justice for all that are oppressed.
102.4: Who satisfieth thine old age with good things; So that Thy youth is renewed like the eagle.
102.7: The LORD is full of compassion and gracious, Slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
102.6: He made known His ways unto Moses, His doings unto the children of Israel.
102.9: He hath not dealt with us after our sins, Nor requited us according to our iniquities.
102.8: He will not always contend; Neither will He keep His anger for ever.
102.11: As far as the east is from the west, So far hath He removed our transgressions from us.
102.10: For as the heaven is high above the earth, So great is His mercy toward them that fear Him.
102.13: For He knoweth our frame; He remembereth that we are dust.
102.12: Like as a father hath compassion upon his children, So hath the LORD compassion upon them that fear Him. .
102.15: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; And the place thereof knoweth it no more.
102.14: As for man, his days are as grass; As a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
102.17: To such as keep His covenant, And to those that remember His precepts to do them.
102.16: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear Him, And His righteousness unto children's children;
102.19: Bless the LORD, ye angels of His, Ye mighty in strength, that fulfil His word, Hearkening unto the voice of His word.
102.18: The LORD hath established His throne in the heavens; And His kingdom ruleth over all.

103.24: Yonder sea, great and wide, Therein are creeping things innumerable, Living creatures, both small and great.
103.25: There go the ships; There is leviathan, whom Thou hast formed to sport therein.
103.26: All of them wait for Thee, That Thou mayest give them their food in due season.
103.27: Thou givest it unto them, they gather it; Thou openest Thy hand, they are satisfied with good.
103.20: The young lions roar after their prey, And seek their food from God.
103.21: The sun ariseth, they slink away, And couch in their dens.
103.22: Man goeth forth unto his work And to his labour until the evening.
103.23: How manifold are Thy works, O LORD! In wisdom hast Thou made them all; The earth is full of Thy creatures.
103.28: Thou hidest Thy face, they vanish; Thou withdrawest their breath, they perish, And return to their dust.
103.29: Thou sendest forth Thy spirit, they are created; and Thou renewest the face of the earth.
103.1: Who coverest Thyself with light as with a garment, who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain;
103.0: Bless the LORD, O my soul. O LORD my God, Thou art very great; Thou art clothed with glory and majesty.
103.3: Who makest winds Thy messengers, the flaming fire Thy ministers.
103.2: Who layest the beams of Thine upper chambers in the waters, who makest the clouds Thy chariot, who walkest upon the wings of the wind;
103.5: Thou didst cover it with the deep as with a vesture; the waters stood above the mountains.
103.4: Who didst establish the earth upon its foundations, that it should not be moved for ever and ever;
103.7: The mountains rose, the valleys sank down— Unto the place which Thou hadst founded for them;
103.6: At Thy rebuke they fled, at the voice of Thy thunder they hasted away—
103.9: Who sendest forth springs into the valleys; They run between the mountains;
103.8: Thou didst set a bound which they should not pass over, That they might not return to cover the earth.
103.11: Beside them dwell the fowl of the heaven, From among the branches they sing.
103.10: They give drink to every beast of the field, The wild asses quench their thirst. .
103.13: Who causeth the grass to spring up for the cattle, And herb for the service of man; To bring forth bread out of the earth,
103.12: Who waterest the mountains from Thine upper chambers; The earth is full of the fruit of Thy works.
103.15: The trees of the LORD have their fill, The cedars of Lebanon, which He hath planted;
103.14: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, Making the face brighter than oil, And bread that stayeth man's heart.
103.17: The high mountains are for the wild goats; The rocks are a refuge for the conies.
103.16: Wherein the birds make their nests; As for the stork, the fir-trees are her house.
103.19: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, Wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.
103.18: Who appointedst the moon for seasons; The sun knoweth his going down.
103.31: Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth; He toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
103.30: May the glory of the LORD endure for ever; let the LORD rejoice in His works!
103.34: Let sinners cease out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the LORD, O my soul. Hallelujah.
103.33: Let my musing be sweet unto Him; as for me, I will rejoice in the LORD.
103.32: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.

100.1: I will give heed unto the way of integrity; oh when wilt Thou come unto me? I will walk within my house in the integrity of my heart.
100.0: A Psalm of David. I will sing of mercy and justice; unto Thee, O LORD, will I sing praises.
100.3: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will know no evil thing.
100.2: I will set no base thing before mine eyes; I hate the doing of things crooked; it shall not cleave unto me.
100.5: Mine eyes are upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he that walketh in a way of integrity, he shall minister unto me.
100.4: Whoso slandereth his neighbour in secret, him will I destroy; Whoso is haughty of eye and proud of heart, him will I not suffer.
100.7: Morning by morning will I destroy all the wicked of the land; to cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the LORD.
100.6: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house; he that speaketh falsehood shall not be established before mine eyes.

101.24: I say: 'O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days, Thou whose years endure throughout all generations.
101.25: Of old Thou didst lay the foundation of the earth; And the heavens are the work of Thy hands.
101.26: They shall perish, but Thou shalt endure; Yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; As a vesture shalt Thou change them, and they shall pass away;
101.27: But Thou art the selfsame, And Thy years shall have no end.
101.20: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; To loose those that are appointed to death;
101.21: That men may tell of the name of the LORD in Zion, And His praise in Jerusalem; .
101.22: When the peoples are gathered together, And the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
101.23: He weakened my strength in the way; He shortened my days.
101.28: The children of Thy servants shall dwell securely, And their seed shall be established before Thee.'
101.1: O LORD, hear my prayer, and let my cry come unto Thee.
101.0: A Prayer of the afflicted, when he fainteth, and poureth out his complaint before the LORD.
101.3: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as a hearth.
101.2: Hide not Thy face from me in the day of my distress; incline Thine ear unto me; in the day when I call answer me speedily.
101.5: By reason of the voice of my sighing My bones cleave to my flesh.
101.4: My heart is smitten like grass, and withered; for I forget to eat my bread.
101.7: I watch, and am become like a sparrow that is alone upon the housetop.
101.6: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am become as an owl of the waste places.
101.9: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
101.8: Mine enemies taunt me all the day; they that are mad against me do curse by me.
101.11: My days are like a lengthening shadow; and I am withered like grass.
101.10: Because of Thine indignation and Thy wrath; for Thou hast taken me up, and cast me away.
101.13: Thou wilt arise, and have compassion upon Zion; for it is time to be gracious unto her, for the appointed time is come.
101.12: But Thou, O LORD, sittest enthroned for ever; and Thy name is unto all generations.
101.15: So the nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth Thy glory;
101.14: For Thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and love her dust.
101.17: When He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute, And hath not despised their prayer.
101.16: When the LORD hath built up Zion, when He hath appeared in His glory;
101.19: For He hath looked down from the height of His sanctuary; From heaven did the LORD behold the earth;
101.18: This shall be written for the generation to come; And a people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.

106.42: Whoso is wise, let him observe these things, And let them consider the mercies of the LORD.
106.24: For He commanded, and raised the stormy wind, Which lifted up the waves thereof;
106.25: They mounted up to the heaven, they went down to the deeps; Their soul melted away because of trouble;
106.26: They reeled to and fro, and staggered like a drunken man, And all their wisdom was swallowed up—
106.27: They cried unto the LORD in their trouble, And He brought them out of their distresses.
106.20: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
106.21: And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And declare His works with singing.
106.22: They that go down to the sea in ships, That do business in great waters—
106.23: These saw the works of the LORD, And His wonders in the deep;
106.28: He made the storm a calm, So that the waves thereof were still.
106.29: Then were they glad because they were quiet, And He led them unto their desired haven.
106.40: Yet setteth He the needy on high from affliction, And maketh his families like a flock.
106.41: The upright see it, and are glad; And all iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
106.1: So let the redeemed of the LORD say, Whom He hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary;
106.0: 'O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, For His mercy endureth for ever.'
106.3: They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way; They found no city of habitation.
106.2: And gathered them out of the lands, From the east and from the west, From the north and from the sea.
106.5: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, And He delivered them out of their distresses.
106.4: Hungry and thirsty, Their soul fainted in them.
106.7: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
106.6: And He led them by a straight way, That they might go to a city of habitation.
106.9: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, Being bound in affliction and iron—
106.8: For He hath satisfied the longing soul, And the hungry soul He hath filled with good.
106.39: He poureth contempt upon princes, And causeth them to wander in the waste, where there is no way.
106.38: Again, they are minished and dwindle away Through oppression of evil and sorrow.
106.11: Therefore He humbled their heart with travail, They stumbled, and there was none to help—
106.10: Because they rebelled against the words of God, And contemned the counsel of the Most High.
106.13: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And broke their bands in sunder. .
106.12: They cried unto the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses.
106.15: For He hath broken the gates of brass, And cut the bars of iron in sunder.
106.14: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
106.17: Their soul abhorred all manner of food, And they drew near unto the gates of death—
106.16: Crazed because of the way of their transgression, And afflicted because of their iniquities—
106.19: He sent His word, and healed them, And delivered them from their graves.
106.18: They cried unto the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses;
106.31: Let them exalt Him also in the assembly of the people, And praise Him in the seat of the elders.
106.30: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
106.37: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly, And suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
106.36: And sow fields, and plant vineyards, Which yield fruits of increase.
106.35: And there He maketh the hungry to dwell, And they establish a city of habitation;
106.34: He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water, And a dry land into watersprings.
106.33: A fruitful land into a salt waste, For the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
106.32: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, And watersprings into a thirsty ground;

107.11: Hast not Thou cast us off, O God? And Thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts?
107.10: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me unto Edom?
107.13: Through God we shall do valiantly; For He it is that will tread down our adversaries.
107.12: Give us help against the adversary; For vain is the help of man.
107.1: My heart is steadfast, O God; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises, even with my glory.
107.0: A Song, a Psalm of David.
107.3: I will give thanks unto Thee, O LORD, among the peoples; And I will sing praises unto Thee among the nations.
107.2: Awake, psaltery and harp; I will awake the dawn.
107.5: Be Thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; And Thy glory be above all the earth.
107.4: For Thy mercy is great above the heavens, And Thy truth reacheth unto the skies.
107.7: God spoke in His holiness, that I would exult; That I would divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
107.6: That Thy beloved may be delivered, Save with Thy right hand, and answer me.
107.9: Moab is my washpot; Upon Edom do I cast my shoe; Over Philistia do I cry aloud.
107.8: Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre.

104.42: And He brought forth His people with joy, His chosen ones with singing.
104.43: And He gave them the lands of the nations, And they took the labour of the peoples in possession;
104.24: He turned their heart to hate His people, To deal craftily with His servants.
104.25: He sent Moses His servant, And Aaron whom He had chosen.
104.26: They wrought among them His manifold signs, And wonders in the land of Ham.
104.27: He sent darkness, and it was dark; And they rebelled not against His word.
104.20: He made him lord of his house, And ruler of all his possessions;
104.21: To bind his princes at his pleasure, And teach his elders wisdom.
104.22: Israel also came into Egypt; And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
104.23: And He increased His people greatly, And made them too mighty for their adversaries.
104.44: That they might keep His statutes, And observe His laws. Hallelujah.
104.28: He turned their waters into blood, And slew their fish.
104.29: Their land swarmed with frogs, In the chambers of their kings.
104.40: He opened the rock, and waters gushed out; They ran, a river in the dry places.
104.41: For He remembered His holy word Unto Abraham His servant;
104.1: Sing unto Him, sing praises unto Him; Speak ye of all His marvellous works.
104.0: O give thanks unto the LORD, call upon His name; Make known His doings among the peoples.
104.3: Seek ye the LORD and His strength; Seek His face continually.
104.2: Glory ye in His holy name; Let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
104.5: O ye seed of Abraham His servant, Ye children of Jacob, His chosen ones.
104.4: Remember His marvellous works that He hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth;
104.7: He hath remembered His covenant for ever, The word which He commanded to a thousand generations;
104.6: He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
104.9: And He established it unto Jacob for a statute, To Israel for an everlasting covenant;
104.8: [The covenant] which He made with Abraham, And His oath unto Isaac;
104.39: They asked, and He brought quails, And gave them in plenty the bread of heaven.
104.38: He spread a cloud for a screen; And fire to give light in the night.
104.11: When they were but a few men in number. Yea, very few, and sojourners in it,
104.10: Saying: 'Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance.'
104.13: He suffered no man to do them wrong, Yea, for their sake He reproved kings:
104.12: And when they went about from nation to nation, From one kingdom to another people,
104.15: And He called a famine upon the land; He broke the whole staff of bread.
104.14: 'Touch not Mine anointed ones, And do My prophets no harm.'
104.17: His feet they hurt with fetters, His person was laid in iron;
104.16: He sent a man before them; Joseph was sold for a servant;
104.19: The king sent and loosed him; Even the ruler of the peoples, and set him free.
104.18: Until the time that his word came to pass, The word of the LORD tested him.
104.31: He gave them hail for rain, And flaming fire in their land.
104.30: He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, And gnats in all their borders.
104.37: Egypt was glad when they departed; For the fear of them had fallen upon them.
104.36: And He brought them forth with silver and gold; And there was none that stumbled among His tribes.
104.35: He smote also all the first-born in their land, The first-fruits of all their strength.
104.34: And did eat up every herb in their land, And did eat up the fruit of their ground.
104.33: He spoke, and the locust came, And the canker-worm without number,
104.32: He smote their vines also and their fig-trees; And broke the trees of their borders.

105.42: Many times did He deliver them; But they were rebellious in their counsel, And sank low through their iniquity.
105.43: Nevertheless He looked upon their distress, When He heard their cry;
105.24: And they murmured in their tents, They hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.
105.25: Therefore He swore concerning them, That He would overthrow them in the wilderness;
105.26: And that He would cast out their seed among the nations, And scatter them in the lands.
105.27: They joined themselves also unto Baal of Peor, And ate the sacrifices of the dead.
105.20: They forgot God their saviour, Who had done great things in Egypt;
105.21: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, Terrible things by the Red Sea.
105.22: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, Had not Moses His chosen stood before Him in the breach, To turn back His wrath, lest He should destroy them.
105.23: Moreover, they scorned the desirable land, They believed not His word;
105.46: Save us, O LORD our God, And gather us from among the nations, That we may give thanks unto Thy holy name, That we may triumph in Thy praise.
105.47: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting, and let all the people say: 'Amen.' Hallelujah.
105.44: And He remembered for them His covenant, And repented according to the multitude of His mercies.
105.45: He made them also to be pitied Of all those that carried them captive.
105.28: Thus they provoked Him with their doings, And the plague broke in upon them.
105.29: Then stood up Phinehas, and wrought judgment, And so the plague was stayed.
105.40: And He gave them into the hand of the nations; And they that hated them ruled over them.
105.41: Their enemies also oppressed them, And they were subdued under their hand.
105.1: Who can express the mighty acts of the LORD, or make all His praise to be heard?
105.0: Hallelujah. O give thanks unto the LORD; for He is good; for His mercy endureth for ever.
105.3: Remember me, O LORD, when Thou favourest Thy people; O think of me at Thy salvation;
105.2: Happy are they that keep justice, that do righteousness at all times.
105.5: We have sinned with our fathers, we have done iniquitously, we have dealt wickedly.
105.4: That I may behold the prosperity of Thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of Thy nation, that I may glory with Thine inheritance.
105.7: Nevertheless He saved them for His name's sake, that He might make His mighty power to be known.
105.6: Our fathers in Egypt gave no heed unto Thy wonders; they remembered not the multitude of Thy mercies; but were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
105.9: And He saved them from the hand of him that hated them, And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
105.8: And He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up; and He led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.
105.39: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against His people, And He abhorred His inheritance.
105.38: Thus were they defiled with their works, And went astray in their doings.
105.11: Then believed they His words; They sang His praise.
105.10: And the waters covered their adversaries; There was not one of them left.
105.13: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, And tried God in the desert.
105.12: They soon forgot His works; They waited not for His counsel;
105.15: They were jealous also of Moses in the camp, And of Aaron the holy one of the LORD.
105.14: And He gave them their request; But sent leanness into their soul.
105.17: And a fire was kindled in their company; The flame burned up the wicked.
105.16: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, And covered the company of Abiram.
105.19: Thus they exchanged their glory For the likeness of an ox that eateth grass.
105.18: They made a calf in Horeb, And worshipped a molten image.
105.31: They angered Him also at the waters of Meribah, And it went ill with Moses because of them;
105.30: And that was counted unto him for righteousness, Unto all generations for ever.
105.37: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, Whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; And the land was polluted with blood.
105.36: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,
105.35: And they served their idols, Which became a snare unto them;
105.34: But mingled themselves with the nations, And learned their works;
105.33: They did not destroy the peoples, As the LORD commanded them;
105.32: For they embittered his spirit, And he spoke rashly with his lips.

39.11: Thou, O LORD, wilt not withhold Thy compassions from me; let Thy mercy and Thy truth continually preserve me.
39.10: I have not hid Thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared Thy faithfulness and Thy salvation; I have not concealed Thy mercy and Thy truth from the great congregation.
39.13: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me; O LORD, make haste to help me.
39.12: For innumerable evils have compassed me about, mine iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of my head, and my heart hath failed me.
39.15: Let them be appalled by reason of their shame that say unto me: 'Aha, aha.'
39.14: Let them be ashamed and abashed together that seek after my soul to sweep it away; let them be turned backward and brought to confusion that delight in my hurt.
39.17: But, as for me, that am poor and needy, the Lord will account it unto me; Thou art my help and my deliverer; O my God, tarry not.
39.16: Let all those that seek Thee rejoice and be glad in Thee; let such as love Thy salvation say continually: 'The LORD be magnified.'
39.1: I waited patiently for the LORD; and He inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
39.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
39.3: And He hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God; many shall see, and fear, and shall trust in the LORD.
39.2: He brought me up also out of the tumultuous pit, out of the miry clay; and He set my feet upon a rock, He established my goings.
39.5: Many things hast Thou done, O LORD my God, even Thy wonderful works, and Thy thoughts toward us; there is none to be compared unto Thee! If I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be told.
39.4: Happy is the man that hath made the LORD his trust, and hath not turned unto the arrogant, nor unto such as fall away treacherously.
39.7: Then said I: 'Lo, I am come with the roll of a book which is prescribed for me;
39.6: Sacrifice and meal-offering Thou hast no delight in; mine ears hast Thou opened; burnt-offering and sin-offering hast Thou not required.
39.9: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation, Lo, I did not refrain my lips; O LORD, Thou knowest.
39.8: I delight to do Thy will, O my God; yea, Thy law is in my inmost parts.'

38.11: With rebukes dost Thou chasten man for iniquity, and like a moth Thou makest his beauty to consume away; surely every man is vanity. Selah
38.10: Remove Thy stroke from off me; I am consumed by the blow of Thy hand.
38.13: Look away from me, that I may take comfort, before I go hence, and be no more.'
38.12: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear unto my cry; keep not silence at my tears; for I am a stranger with Thee, a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
38.1: I said: 'I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue; I will keep a curb upon my mouth, while the wicked is before me.'
38.0: For the Leader, for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
38.3: My heart waxed hot within me; while I was musing, the fire kindled; Then spoke I with my tongue:
38.2: I was dumb with silence; I held my peace, had no comfort; and my pain was held in check.
38.5: Behold, Thou hast made my days as hand-breadths; and mine age is as nothing before Thee; surely every man at his best estate is altogether vanity. Selah
38.4: 'LORD, make me to know mine end, And the measure of my days, what it is; Let me know how short-lived I am.
38.7: And now, Lord, what wait I for? My hope, it is in Thee.
38.6: Surely man walketh as a mere semblance; surely for vanity they are in turmoil; He heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
38.9: I am dumb, I open not my mouth; because Thou hast done it.
38.8: Deliver me from all my transgressions; make me not the reproach of the base.

33.20: He keepeth all his bones; Not one of them is broken.
33.21: Evil shall kill the wicked; And they that hate the righteous shall be held guilty.
33.22: The LORD redeemeth the soul of His servants; And none of them that take refuge in Him shall be desolate.
33.1: I will bless the LORD at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.
33.0: [A Psalm] of David; when he changed his demeanour before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.
33.3: O magnify the LORD with me, And let us exalt His name together.
33.2: My soul shall glory in the LORD; The humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
33.5: They looked unto Him, and were radiant; And their faces shall never be abashed.
33.4: I sought the LORD, and He answered me, And delivered me from all my fears.
33.7: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear Him, And delivereth them.
33.6: This poor man cried, and the LORD heard, And saved him out of all his troubles.
33.9: O fear the LORD, ye His holy ones;  For there is no want to them that fear Him.
33.8: O consider and see that the LORD is good; Happy is the man that taketh refuge in Him.
33.11: Come, ye children, hearken unto me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
33.10: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger; But they that seek the LORD want not any good thing.
33.13: Keep thy tongue from evil, And thy lips from speaking guile.
33.12: Who is the man that desireth life, and loveth days, That he may see good therein?
33.15: The eyes of the LORD are toward the righteous, And His ears are open unto their cry.
33.14: Depart from evil, and do good; Seek peace, and pursue it.
33.17: They cried, and the LORD heard, And delivered them out of all their troubles.
33.16: The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, To cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
33.19: Many are the ills of the righteous, But the LORD delivereth him out of them all.
33.18: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart, And saveth such as are of a contrite spirit.

32.20: For in Him doth our heart rejoice, Because we have trusted in His holy name.
32.21: Let Thy mercy, O LORD, be upon us, According as we have waited for Thee.
32.1: Give thanks unto the LORD with harp, Sing praises unto Him with the psaltery of ten strings.
32.0: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous, Praise is comely for the upright.
32.3: For the word of the LORD is upright; And all His work is done in faithfulness.
32.2: Sing unto Him a new song; Play skilfully amid shouts of joy.
32.5: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made; And all the host of them by the breath of His mouth.
32.4: He loveth righteousness and justice; The earth is full of the lovingkindness of the LORD.
32.7: Let all the earth fear the LORD; Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
32.6: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap; He layeth up the deeps in storehouses.
32.9: The LORD bringeth the counsel of the nations to nought; He maketh the thoughts of the peoples to be of no effect.
32.8: For He spoke, and it was; He commanded, and it stood.
32.11: Happy is the nation whose God is the LORD; The people whom He hath chosen for His own inheritance.
32.10: The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever, The thoughts of His heart to all generations.
32.13: From the place of His habitation He looketh intently Upon all the inhabitants of the earth;
32.12: The LORD looketh from heaven; He beholdeth all the sons of men;
32.15: A king is not saved by the multitude of a host; A mighty man is not delivered by great strength.
32.14: He that fashioneth the hearts of them all, That considereth all their doings.
32.17: Behold, the eye of the LORD is toward them that fear Him, Toward them that wait for His mercy;
32.16: A horse is a vain thing for safety; Neither doth it afford escape by its great strength.
32.19: Our soul hath waited for the LORD; He is our help and our shield.
32.18: To deliver their soul from death, And to keep them alive in famine.

31.10: Be glad in the LORD, and rejoice, ye righteous; And shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
31.1: Happy is the man unto whom the LORD counteth not iniquity, And in whose spirit there is no guile.
31.0: [A Psalm] of David. Maschil. Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is pardoned.
31.3: For day and night Thy hand was heavy upon me; My sap was turned as in the droughts of summer. Selah
31.2: When I kept silence, my bones wore away Through my groaning all the day long.
31.5: For this let every one that is godly pray unto Thee in a time when Thou mayest be found; Surely, when the great waters overflow, they will not reach unto him.
31.4: I acknowledged my sin unto Thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid; I said: 'I will make confession concerning my transgressions unto the LORD' — And Thou, Thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah
31.7: 'I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go; I will give counsel, Mine eye being upon thee.'
31.6: Thou art my hiding-place; Thou wilt preserve me from the adversary; With songs of deliverance Thou wilt compass me about. Selah
31.9: Many are the sorrows of the wicked; But he that trusteth in the LORD, mercy compasseth him about.
31.8: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding; Whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, That they come not near unto thee.

30.24: Be strong, and let your heart take courage, All ye that wait for the LORD.
30.20: Thou hidest them in the covert of Thy presence from the plottings of man; Thou concealest them in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
30.21: Blessed be the LORD; For He hath shown me His wondrous lovingkindness in an entrenched city.
30.22: As for me, I said in my haste: 'I am cut off from before Thine eyes'; Nevertheless Thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto Thee.
30.23: O love the LORD, all ye His godly ones; The LORD preserveth the faithful, And plentifully repayeth him that acteth haughtily.
30.1: In thee, O LORD, have I taken refuge; let me never be ashamed; Deliver me in Thy righteousness.
30.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
30.3: For Thou art my rock and my fortress; Therefore for Thy name's sake lead me and guide me.
30.2: Incline Thine ear unto me, deliver me speedily; Be Thou to me a rock of refuge, even a fortress of defence, to save me.
30.5: Into Thy hand I commit my spirit; Thou hast redeemed me, O LORD, Thou God of truth.
30.4: Bring me forth out of the net that they have hidden for me; For Thou art my stronghold.
30.7: I will be glad and rejoice in Thy lovingkindness; For Thou hast seen mine affliction, Thou hast taken cognizance of the troubles of my soul,
30.6: I hate them that regard lying vanities; But I trust in the LORD.
30.9: Be gracious unto me, O LORD, for I am in distress; Mine eye wasteth away with vexation, yea, my soul and my body.
30.8: And Thou hast not given me over into the hand of the enemy; Thou hast set my feet in a broad place.
30.11: Because of all mine adversaries I am become a reproach, Yea, unto my neighbours exceedingly, and a dread to mine acquaintance; They that see me without flee from me.
30.10: For my life is spent in sorrow, and my years in sighing; My strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are wasted away.
30.13: For I have heard the whispering of many, Terror on every side; While they took counsel together against me, They devised to take away my life.
30.12: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind; I am like a useless vessel.
30.15: My times are in Thy hand; Deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
30.14: But as for me, I have trusted in Thee, O LORD; I have said: 'Thou art my God.'
30.17: O LORD, let me not be ashamed, for I have called upon Thee; Let the wicked be ashamed, let them be put to silence in the nether-world.
30.16: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy servant; Save me in Thy lovingkindness.
30.19: Oh how abundant is Thy goodness, which Thou hast laid up for them that fear Thee; Which Thou hast wrought for them that take their refuge in Thee, in the sight of the sons of men!
30.18: Let the lying lips be dumb, Which speak arrogantly against the righteous, With pride and contempt.

37.20: They also that repay evil for good are adversaries unto me, because I follow the thing that is good.
37.21: Forsake me not, O LORD; O my God, be not far from me.
37.22: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation.
37.1: O LORD, rebuke me not in Thine anger; neither chasten me in Thy wrath.
37.0: A Psalm of David, to make memorial.
37.3: There is no soundness in my flesh because of Thine indignation; neither is there any health in my bones because of my sin.
37.2: For Thine arrows are gone deep into me, and Thy hand is come down upon me.
37.5: My wounds are noisome, they fester, because of my foolishness.
37.4: For mine iniquities are gone over my head; as a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
37.7: For my loins are filled with burning; and there is no soundness in my flesh.
37.6: I am bent and bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day.
37.9: Lord, all my desire is before Thee; and my sighing is not hid from Thee.
37.8: I am benumbed and sore crushed; I groan by reason of the moaning of my heart.
37.11: My friends and my companions stand aloof from my plague; and my kinsmen stand afar off.
37.10: My heart fluttereth, my strength faileth me; as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.
37.13: But I am as a deaf man, I hear not; and I am as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
37.12: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me; and they that seek my hurt speak crafty devices, and utter deceits all the day.
37.15: For in Thee, O LORD, do I hope; Thou wilt answer, O Lord my God.
37.14: Yea, I am become as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no arguments.
37.17: For I am ready to halt, and my pain is continually before me.
37.16: For I said: 'Lest they rejoice over me; when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.'
37.19: But mine enemies are strong in health; and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
37.18: For I do declare mine iniquity; I am full of care because of my sin.

36.24: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
36.25: All the day long he dealeth graciously, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.
36.26: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.
36.27: For the LORD loveth justice, And forsaketh not His saints; they are preserved for ever; but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
36.20: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not; but the righteous dealeth graciously, and giveth.
36.21: For such as are blessed of Him shall inherit the land; and they that are cursed of Him shall be cut off.
36.22: It is of the LORD that a man's goings are established; and He delighted in his way.
36.23: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down; for the LORD upholdeth his hand.
36.28: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.
36.29: The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, and his tongue speaketh justice.
36.1: For they shall soon wither like the grass, and fade as the green herb.
36.0: [A Psalm] of David. Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, neither be thou envious against them that work unrighteousness.
36.3: So shalt thou delight thyself in the LORD; and He shall give thee the petitions of thy heart.
36.2: Trust in the LORD, and do good; dwell in the land, and cherish faithfulness.
36.5: And He will make thy righteousness to go forth as the light, and thy right as the noonday.
36.4: Commit thy way unto the LORD; trust also in Him, and He will bring it to pass.
36.7: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; fret not thyself, it tendeth only to evil-doing.
36.6: Resign thyself unto the LORD, and wait patiently for Him; fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
36.9: And yet a little while, and the wicked is no more; yea, thou shalt look well at his place, and he is not.
36.8: For evil-doers shall be cut off; but those that wait for the LORD, they shall inherit the land.
36.39: And the LORD helpeth them, and delivereth them; He delivereth them from the wicked, and saveth them, because they have taken refuge in Him.
36.38: But the salvation of the righteous is of the LORD; He is their stronghold in the time of trouble.
36.11: The wicked plotteth against the righteous, and gnasheth at him with his teeth.
36.10: But the humble shall inherit the land, and delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
36.13: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow; to cast down the poor and needy, to slay such as are upright in the way;
36.12: The Lord doth laugh at him; for He seeth that his day is coming.
36.15: Better is a little that the righteous hath than the abundance of many wicked.
36.14: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
36.17: The LORD knoweth the days of them that are wholehearted; and their inheritance shall be for ever.
36.16: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken; but the LORD upholdeth the righteous.
36.19: For the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be as the fat of lambs— They shall pass away in smoke, they shall pass away.
36.18: They shall not be ashamed in the time of evil; and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
36.31: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.
36.30: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps slide.
36.37: But transgressors shall be destroyed together; the future of the wicked shall be cut off.
36.36: Mark the man of integrity, and behold the upright; for there is a future for the man of peace.
36.35: But one passed by, and, lo, he was not; yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.
36.34: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a leafy tree in its native soil.
36.33: Wait for the LORD, and keep His way, and He will exalt thee to inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.
36.32: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor suffer him to be condemned when he is judged.

35.11: Let not the foot of pride overtake me, And let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
35.10: O continue Thy lovingkindness unto them that know Thee; And Thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
35.12: There are the workers of iniquity fallen; They are thrust down, and are not able to rise.
35.1: Transgression speaketh to the wicked, methinks— There is no fear of God before his eyes.
35.0: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David the servant of the LORD.
35.3: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit; He hath left off to be wise, to do good.
35.2: For it flattereth him in his eyes, Until his iniquity be found, and he be hated.
35.5: Thy lovingkindness, O LORD, is in the heavens; Thy faithfulness reacheth unto the skies.
35.4: He deviseth iniquity upon his bed; He setteth himself in a way that is not good; He abhorreth not evil.
35.7: How precious is Thy lovingkindness, O God! And the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Thy wings.
35.6: Thy righteousness is like the mighty mountains; Thy judgments are like the great deep; Man and beast Thou preservest, O LORD.
35.9: For with Thee is the fountain of life; In Thy light do we see light.
35.8: They are abundantly satisfied with the fatness of Thy house; And Thou makest them drink of the river of Thy pleasures.

34.24: Let them not say in their heart: 'Aha, we have our desire'; Let them not say: 'We have swallowed him up.'
34.25: Let them be ashamed and abashed together that rejoice at my hurt; Let them be clothed with shame and confusion that magnify themselves against me. .
34.26: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that delight in my righteousness; Yea, let them say continually: 'Magnified be the LORD, Who delighteth in the peace of His servant.'
34.27: And my tongue shall speak of Thy righteousness, And of Thy praise all the day.
34.20: Yea, they open their mouth wide against me; They say: 'Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.'
34.21: Thou hast seen, O LORD; keep not silence; O Lord, be not far from me.
34.22: Rouse Thee, and awake to my judgment, Even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
34.23: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to Thy righteousness; And let them not rejoice over me.
34.1: Take hold of shield and buckler, And rise up to my help.
34.0: [A Psalm] of David. Strive, O LORD, with them that strive with me; Fight against them that fight against me.
34.3: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion that seek after my soul; Let them be turned back and be abashed that devise my hurt.
34.2: Draw out also the spear, and the battle-axe, against them that pursue me; Say unto my soul: 'I am Thy salvation.'
34.5: Let their way be dark and slippery, The angel of the LORD pursuing them.
34.4: Let them be as chaff before the wind, The angel of the LORD thrusting them.
34.7: Let destruction come upon him unawares; And let his net that he hath hid catch himself; With destruction let him fall therein.
34.6: For without cause have they hid for me the pit, even their net, Without cause have they digged for my soul. .
34.9: All my bones shall say: 'LORD, who is like unto Thee, Who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, Yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?'
34.8: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD; It shall rejoice in His salvation.
34.11: They repay me evil for good; Bereavement is come to my soul.
34.10: Unrighteous witnesses rise up; They ask me of things that I know not.
34.13: I went about as though it had been my friend or my brother; I bowed down mournful, as one that mourneth for his mother.
34.12: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth, I afflicted my soul with fasting; And my prayer, may it return into mine own bosom.
34.15: With the profanest mockeries of backbiting They gnash at me with their teeth.
34.14: But when I halt they rejoice, and gather themselves together; The abjects gather themselves together against me, and those whom I know not; They tear me, and cease not;
34.17: I will give Thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise Thee among a numerous people.
34.16: Lord, how long wilt Thou look on? Rescue my soul from their destructions, Mine only one from the lions.
34.19: For they speak not peace; But they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
34.18: Let not them that are wrongfully mine enemies rejoice over me; Neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

60.1: Hear my cry, O God; Attend unto my prayer.
60.0: For the Leader; with string-music. [A Psalm] of David.
60.3: For Thou hast been a refuge for me, A tower of strength in the face of the enemy.
60.2: From the end of the earth will I call unto Thee, when my heart fainteth; Lead me to a rock that is too high for me.
60.5: For Thou, O God, hast heard my vows; Thou hast granted the heritage of those that fear Thy name. .
60.4: I will dwell in Thy Tent for ever; I will take refuge in the covert of Thy wings. Selah
60.7: May he be enthroned before God for ever! Appoint mercy and truth, that they may preserve him.
60.6: Mayest Thou add days unto the king's days! May his years be as many generations!
60.8: So will I sing praise unto Thy name for ever, That I may daily perform my vows.

61.11: God hath spoken once, Twice have I heard this: That strength belongeth unto God;
61.10: Trust not in oppression, And put not vain hope in robbery; If riches increase, set not your heart thereon.
61.12: Also unto Thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy; For Thou renderest to every man according to his work.
61.1: Only for God doth my soul wait in stillness; From Him cometh my salvation.
61.0: For the Leader; for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
61.3: How long will ye set upon a man, That ye may slay him, all of you, As a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
61.2: He only is my rock and my salvation, My high tower, I shall not be greatly moved.
61.5: Only for God wait thou in stillness, my soul; For from Him cometh my hope.
61.4: They only devise to thrust him down from his height, delighting in lies; They bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah
61.7: Upon God resteth my salvation and my glory; The rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
61.6: He only is my rock and my salvation, My high tower, I shall not be moved.
61.9: Men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie; If they be laid in the balances, they are together lighter than vanity.
61.8: Trust in Him at all times, ye people; Pour out your heart before Him; God is a refuge for us. Selah

62.11: But the king shall rejoice in God; Every one that sweareth by Him shall glory; For the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
62.10: They shall be hurled to the power of the sword; They shall be a portion for foxes.
62.1: O God, Thou art my God, earnestly will I seek Thee; My soul thirsteth for Thee, my flesh longeth for Thee, In a dry and weary land, where no water is.
62.0: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
62.3: For Thy lovingkindness is better than life; My lips shall praise Thee.
62.2: So have I looked for Thee in the sanctuary, To see Thy power and Thy glory. .
62.5: My soul is satisfied as with marrow and fatness; And my mouth doth praise Thee with joyful lips;
62.4: So will I bless Thee as long as I live; In Thy name will I lift up my hands.
62.7: For Thou hast been my help, And in the shadow of Thy wings do I rejoice.
62.6: When I remember Thee upon my couch, And meditate on Thee in the night-watches.
62.9: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, Shall go into the nethermost parts of the earth.
62.8: My soul cleaveth unto Thee; Thy right hand holdeth me fast.

63.10: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall take refuge in Him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
63.1: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; preserve my life from the terror of the enemy.
63.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
63.3: Who have whet their tongue like a sword, and have aimed their arrow, a poisoned word;
63.2: Hide me from the council of evil-doers; from the tumult of the workers of iniquity;
63.5: They encourage one another in an evil matter; they converse of laying snares secretly; they ask, who would see them.
63.4: That they may shoot in secret places at the blameless; suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
63.7: But God doth shoot at them with an arrow suddenly; thence are their wounds.
63.6: They search out iniquities, they have accomplished a diligent search; even in the inward thought of every one, and the deep heart.
63.9: And all men fear; and they declare the work of God, and understand His doing.
63.8: So they make their own tongue a stumbling unto themselves; all that see them shake the head.

64.11: Thou crownest the year with Thy goodness; and Thy paths drop fatness.
64.10: Watering her ridges abundantly, settling down the furrows thereof, Thou makest her soft with showers; Thou blessest the growth thereof.
64.13: The meadows are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, yea, they sing.
64.12: The pastures of the wilderness do drop; and the hills are girded with joy.
64.1: Praise waiteth for Thee, O God, in Zion; and unto Thee the vow is performed.
64.0: For the Leader. A Psalm. A Song of David.
64.3: The tale of iniquities is too heavy for me; as for our transgressions, Thou wilt pardon them.
64.2: O Thou that hearest prayer, unto Thee doth all flesh come.
64.5: With wondrous works dost Thou answer us in righteousness, O God of our salvation; Thou the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of the far distant seas;
64.4: Happy is the man whom Thou choosest, and bringest near, that he may dwell in Thy courts; may we be satisfied with the goodness of Thy house, the holy place of Thy temple!
64.7: Who stillest the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples;
64.6: Who by Thy strength settest fast the mountains, who art girded about with might;
64.9: Thou hast remembered the earth, and watered her, greatly enriching her, with the river of God that is full of water; Thou preparest them corn, for so preparest Thou her.
64.8: So that they that dwell in the uttermost parts stand in awe of Thy signs; Thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

65.11: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; We went through fire and through water; But Thou didst bring us out unto abundance.
65.10: Thou didst bring us into the hold; Thou didst lay constraint upon our loins.
65.13: Which my lips have uttered, And my mouth hath spoken, when I was in distress.
65.12: I will come into Thy house with burnt-offerings, I will perform unto Thee my vows,
65.15: Come, and hearken, all ye that fear God, And I will declare what He hath done for my soul.
65.14: I will offer unto Thee burnt-offerings of fatlings, With the sweet smoke of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah
65.17: If I had regarded iniquity in my heart, The Lord would not hear;
65.16: I cried unto Him with my mouth, And He was extolled with my tongue.
65.19: Blessed be God, Who hath not turned away my prayer, nor His mercy from me.
65.18: But verily God hath heard; He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
65.1: Sing praises unto the glory of His name; Make His praise glorious.
65.0: For the Leader. A Song, a Psalm. Shout unto God, all the earth;
65.3: All the earth shall worship Thee, And shall sing praises unto Thee; They shall sing praises to Thy name.' Selah
65.2: Say unto God: 'How tremendous is Thy work! Through the greatness of Thy power shall Thine enemies dwindle away before Thee.
65.5: He turned the sea into dry land; They went through the river on foot; There let us rejoice in Him!
65.4: Come, and see the works of God; He is terrible in His doing toward the children of men.
65.7: Bless our God, ye peoples, And make the voice of His praise to be heard;
65.6: Who ruleth by His might for ever; His eyes keep watch upon the nations; Let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah
65.9: For Thou, O God, hast tried us; Thou hast refined us, as silver is refined.
65.8: Who hath set our soul in life, And suffered not our foot to be moved,

66.1: God be gracious unto us, and bless us; May He cause His face to shine toward us; Selah
66.0: For the Leader; with string-music. A Psalm, a Song.
66.3: Let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, O God; Let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, all of them. .
66.2: That Thy way may be known upon earth, Thy salvation among all nations.
66.5: Let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, O God; Let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, all of them.
66.4: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy; For Thou wilt judge the peoples with equity, And lead the nations upon earth. Selah
66.7: May God bless us; And let all the ends of the earth fear Him.
66.6: The earth hath yielded her increase; May God, our own God, bless us.

67.24: They see Thy goings, O God, Even the goings of my God, my King, in holiness.
67.25: The singers go before, the minstrels follow after, In the midst of damsels playing upon timbrels.
67.26: 'Bless ye God in full assemblies, Even the Lord, ye that are from the fountain of Israel.'
67.27: There is Benjamin, the youngest, ruling them, The princes of Judah their council, The princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
67.20: God is unto us a God of deliverances; And unto GOD the Lord belong the issues of death.
67.21: Surely God will smite through the head of His enemies, The hairy scalp of him that goeth about in his guiltiness.
67.22: The Lord said: 'I will bring back from Bashan, I will bring them back from the depths of the sea;
67.23: That thy foot may wade through blood, That the tongue of thy dogs may have its portion from thine enemies.'
67.28: Thy God hath commanded thy strength; Be strong, O God, Thou that hast wrought for us
67.29: Out of Thy temple at Jerusalem, Whither kings shall bring presents unto Thee.
67.1: Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered; And let them that hate Him flee before Him.
67.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David, a Song.
67.3: But let the righteous be glad, let them exult before God; Yea, let them rejoice with gladness.
67.2: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away; As wax melteth before the fire, So let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
67.5: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, Is God in His holy habitation.
67.4: Sing unto God, sing praises to His name; Extol Him that rideth upon the skies, whose name is the LORD; And exult ye before Him.
67.7: O God, when Thou wentest forth before Thy people, When Thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah
67.6: God maketh the solitary to dwell in a house; He bringeth out the prisoners into prosperity; The rebellious dwell but in a parched land.
67.9: A bounteous rain didst Thou pour down, O God; When Thine inheritance was weary, Thou didst confirm it.
67.8: The earth trembled, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God; Even yon Sinai trembled at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
67.11: The Lord giveth the word; The women that proclaim the tidings are a great host.
67.10: Thy flock settled therein; Thou didst prepare in Thy goodness for the poor, O God.
67.13: When ye lie among the sheepfolds, The wings of the dove are covered with silver, And her pinions with the shimmer of gold. .
67.12: Kings of armies flee, they flee; And she that tarrieth at home divideth the spoil.
67.15: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; A mountain of peaks is the mountain of Bashan.
67.14: When the Almighty scattereth kings therein, It snoweth in Zalmon.
67.17: The chariots of God are myriads, even thousands upon thousands; The Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in holiness.
67.16: Why look ye askance, ye mountains of peaks, At the mountain which God hath desired for His abode? Yea, the LORD will dwell therein for ever.
67.19: Blessed be the Lord, day by day He beareth our burden, Even the God who is our salvation. Selah
67.18: Thou hast ascended on high, Thou hast led captivity captive; Thou hast received gifts among men, Yea, among the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell there.
67.31: Nobles shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall hasten to stretch out her hands unto God.
67.30: Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, The multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples, Every one submitting himself with pieces of silver; He hath scattered the peoples that delight in war!
67.35: Awful is God out of thy holy places; The God of Israel, He giveth strength and power unto the people; Blessed be God.
67.34: Ascribe ye strength unto God; His majesty is over Israel, And His strength is in the skies.
67.33: To Him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which are of old; Lo, He uttereth His voice, a mighty voice.
67.32: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah

68.24: Pour out Thine indignation upon them, And let the fierceness of Thine anger overtake them.
68.25: Let their encampment be desolate; Let none dwell in their tents.
68.26: For they persecute him whom Thou hast smitten; And they tell of the pain of those whom Thou hast wounded.
68.27: Add iniquity unto their iniquity; And let them not come into Thy righteousness.
68.20: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am sore sick; And I looked for some to show compassion, but there was none; And for comforters, but I found none.
68.21: Yea, they put poison into my food; And in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
68.22: Let their table before them become a snare; And when they are in peace, let it become a trap.
68.23: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; And make their loins continually to totter.
68.28: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, And not be written with the righteous.
68.29: But I am afflicted and in pain; Let Thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
68.1: Save me, O God; For the waters are come in even unto the soul.
68.0: For the Leader; upon Shoshannim. [A Psalm] of David.
68.3: I am weary of my crying; my throat is dried; Mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.
68.2: I am sunk in deep mire, where there is no standing; I am come into deep waters, and the flood overwhelmeth me.
68.5: O God, Thou knowest my folly; And my trespasses are not hid from Thee.
68.4: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; They that would cut me off, being mine enemies wrongfully, are many; Should I restore that which I took not away?
68.7: Because for Thy sake I have borne reproach; Confusion hath covered my face.
68.6: Let not them that wait for Thee be ashamed through me, O Lord GOD of hosts; Let not those that seek Thee be brought to confusion through me, O God of Israel.
68.9: Because zeal for Thy house hath eaten me up, And the reproaches of them that reproach Thee are fallen upon me.
68.8: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, And an alien unto my mother's children.
68.11: I made sackcloth also my garment, And I became a byword unto them.
68.10: And I wept with my soul with fasting, And that became unto me a reproach.
68.13: But as for me, let my prayer be unto Thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time; O God, in the abundance of Thy mercy, Answer me with the truth of Thy salvation.
68.12: They that sit in the gate talk of me; And I am the song of the drunkards. .
68.15: Let not the waterflood overwhelm me, Neither let the deep swallow me up; And let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
68.14: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink; Let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
68.17: And hide not Thy face from Thy servant; For I am in distress; answer me speedily.
68.16: Answer me, O LORD, for Thy mercy is good; According to the multitude of Thy compassions turn Thou unto me.
68.19: Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my confusion; Mine adversaries are all before Thee.
68.18: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it; Ransom me because of mine enemies.
68.31: And it shall please the LORD better than a bullock That hath horns and hoofs.
68.30: I will praise the name of God with a song, And will magnify Him with thanksgiving. .
68.36: The seed also of His servants shall inherit it; And they that love His name shall dwell therein.
68.35: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah; And they shall abide there, and have it in possession.
68.34: Let heaven and earth praise Him, The seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
68.33: For the LORD hearkeneth unto the needy, And despiseth not His prisoners.
68.32: The humble shall see it, and be glad; Ye that seek after God, let your heart revive.

69.1: O God, to deliver me, O LORD, to help me, make haste.
69.0: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David; to make memorial.
69.3: Let them be turned back by reason of their shame That say: 'Aha, aha.'
69.2: Let them be ashamed and abashed That seek after my soul; Let them be turned backward and brought to confusion That delight in my hurt.
69.5: But I am poor and needy; O God, make haste unto me; Thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, tarry not.
69.4: Let all those that seek Thee rejoice and be glad in Thee; And let such as love Thy salvation say continually: 'Let God be magnified.'

2.1: LORD, how many are mine adversaries become! Many are they that rise up against me.
2.0: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.
2.3: But thou, O LORD, art a shield about me; My glory, and the lifter up of my head.
2.2: Many there are that say of my soul: 'There is no salvation for him in God.' Selah
2.5: I lay me down, and I sleep; I awake, for the LORD sustaineth me.
2.4: With my voice I call unto the LORD, and He answereth me out of His holy mountain. Selah
2.7: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God; for Thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek, Thou hast broken the teeth of the wicked.
2.6: I am not afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.
2.8: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD; Thy blessing be upon Thy people. Selah

6.11: God is a righteous judge, Yea, a God that hath indignation every day:
6.10: My shield is with God, Who saveth the upright in heart.
