6.13: He hath also prepared for him the weapons of death, Yea, His arrows which He made sharp.
6.12: If a man turn not, He will whet His sword, He hath bent His bow, and made it ready;
6.15: He hath digged a pit, and hollowed it, And is fallen into the ditch which he made.
6.14: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity; Yea, he conceiveth mischief, and bringeth forth falsehood.
6.17: I will give thanks unto the LORD according to His righteousness; And will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.
6.16: His mischief shall return upon his own head, And his violence shall come down upon his own pate.
6.1: O LORD my God, in Thee have I taken refuge; Save me from all them that pursue me, and deliver me;
6.0: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the LORD, concerning Cush a Benjamite.
6.3: O LORD my God, if I have done this; If there be iniquity in my hands;
6.2: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, Rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
6.5: Let the enemy pursue my soul, and overtake it, And tread my life down to the earth; Yea, let him lay my glory in the dust. Selah
6.4: If I have requited him that did evil unto me, Or spoiled mine adversary unto emptiness;
6.7: And let the congregation of the peoples compass Thee about, And over them return Thou on high.
6.6: Arise, O LORD, in Thine anger, Lift up Thyself in indignation against mine adversaries; Yea, awake for me at the judgment which Thou hast commanded.
6.9: Oh that a full measure of evil might come upon the wicked, And that Thou wouldest establish the righteous; For the righteous God trieth the heart and reins.
6.8: O LORD, who ministerest judgment to the peoples, Judge me, O LORD, According to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

99.1: Serve the LORD with gladness; come before His presence with singing.
99.0: A Psalm of thanksgiving. Shout unto the LORD, all the earth.
99.3: Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, and into His courts with praise; give thanks unto Him, and bless His name.
99.2: Know ye that the LORD He is God; it is He that hath made us, and we are His, His people, and the flock of His pasture.
99.4: For the LORD is good; His mercy endureth for ever; and His faithfulness unto all generations.

98.1: The LORD is great in Zion; And He is high above all the peoples.
98.0: The LORD reigneth; let the peoples tremble; He is enthroned upon the cherubim; let the earth quake.
98.3: The strength also of the king who loveth justice— Thou hast established equity, Thou hast executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.
98.2: Let them praise Thy name as great and awful; Holy is He.
98.5: Moses and Aaron among His priests, And Samuel among them that call upon His name, Did call upon the LORD, and He answered them.
98.4: Exalt ye the LORD our God, And prostrate yourselves at His footstool; Holy is He.
98.7: O LORD our God, Thou didst answer them; A forgiving God wast Thou unto them, Though Thou tookest vengeance of their misdeeds.
98.6: He spoke unto them in the pillar of cloud; They kept His testimonies, and the statute that He gave them.
98.8: Exalt ye the LORD our God, And worship at His holy hill; For the LORD our God is holy.

91.11: Mine eye also hath gazed on them that lie in wait for me, Mine ears have heard my desire of the evil-doers that rise up against me.
91.10: But my horn hast Thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox; I am anointed with rich oil.
91.13: Planted in the house of the LORD, They shall flourish in the courts of our God.
91.12: The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree; He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
91.15: To declare that the LORD is upright, My Rock, in whom there is no unrighteousness.
91.14: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; They shall be full of sap and richness;
91.1: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, And to sing praises unto Thy name, O Most High;
91.0: A Psalm, a Song. For the sabbath day.
91.3: With an instrument of ten strings, and with the psaltery; With a solemn sound upon the harp.
91.2: To declare Thy lovingkindness in the morning, And Thy faithfulness in the night seasons,
91.5: How great are Thy works, O LORD! Thy thoughts are very deep.
91.4: For Thou, LORD, hast made me glad through Thy work; I will exult in the works of Thy hands.
91.7: When the wicked spring up as the grass, And when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; It is that they may be destroyed for ever.
91.6: A brutish man knoweth not, Neither doth a fool understand this.
91.9: For, lo, Thine enemies, O LORD, For, lo, Thine enemies shall perish: All the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
91.8: But Thou, O LORD, art on high for evermore.

90.11: They shall bear thee upon their hands, Lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
90.10: For He will give His angels charge over thee, To keep thee in all thy ways.
90.13: 'Because he hath set his love upon Me, therefore will I deliver him; I will set him on high, because he hath known My name.
90.12: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and asp; The young lion and the serpent shalt thou trample under feet.
90.15: With long life will I satisfy him, And make Him to behold My salvation.'
90.14: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue him, and bring him to honour.
90.1: I will say of the LORD, who is my refuge and my fortress, My God, in whom I trust,
90.0: O thou that dwellest in the covert of the Most High, And abidest in the shadow of the Almighty;
90.3: He will cover thee with His pinions, And under His wings shalt thou take refuge; His truth is a shield and a buckler.
90.2: That He will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, And from the noisome pestilence.
90.5: Of the pestilence that walketh in darkness, Nor of the destruction that wasteth at noonday.
90.4: Thou shalt not be afraid of the terror by night, Nor of the arrow that flieth by day;
90.7: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold, And see the recompense of the wicked.
90.6: A thousand may fall at Thy side, And ten thousand at Thy right hand; It shall not come nigh thee.
90.9: There shall no evil befall thee, Neither shall any plague come nigh thy tent.
90.8: For thou hast made the LORD who is my refuge, Even the Most High, thy habitation.

93.20: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, And condemn innocent blood.
93.21: But the LORD hath been my high tower, And my God the rock of my refuge.
93.22: And He hath brought upon them their own iniquity, And will cut them off in their own evil; The LORD our God will cut them off.
93.1: Lift up Thyself, Thou Judge of the earth; Render to the proud their recompense.
93.0: O LORD, Thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, Thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, shine forth.
93.3: They gush out, they speak arrogancy; All the workers of iniquity bear themselves loftily.
93.2: LORD, how long shall the wicked, How long shall the wicked exult?
93.5: They slay the widow and the stranger, And murder the fatherless.
93.4: They crush Thy people, O LORD, And afflict Thy heritage.
93.7: Consider, ye brutish among the people; And ye fools, when will ye understand?
93.6: And they say: 'The LORD will not see, Neither will the God of Jacob give heed.'
93.9: He that instructeth nations, shall not He correct? Even He that teacheth man knowledge?
93.8: He that planted the ear, shall He not hear? He that formed the eye, shall He not see?
93.11: Happy is the man whom Thou instructest, O LORD, And teachest out of Thy law;
93.10: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, That they are vanity.
93.13: For the LORD will not cast off His people, Neither will He forsake His inheritance.
93.12: That Thou mayest give him rest from the days of evil, Until the pit be digged for the wicked.
93.15: Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
93.14: For right shall return unto justice, And all the upright in heart shall follow it.
93.17: If I say: 'My foot slippeth', Thy mercy, O LORD, holdeth me up.
93.16: Unless the LORD had been my help, My soul had soon dwelt in silence.
93.19: Shall the seat of wickedness have fellowship with Thee, Which frameth mischief by statute?
93.18: When my cares are many within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.

92.1: Thy throne is established of old; Thou art from everlasting.
92.0: The LORD reigneth; He is clothed in majesty; The LORD is clothed, He hath girded Himself with strength; Yea, the world is established, that it cannot be moved.
92.3: Above the voices of many waters, The mighty breakers of the sea, The LORD on high is mighty.
92.2: The floods have lifted up, O LORD, The floods have lifted up their voice; The floods lift up their roaring.
92.4: Thy testimonies are very sure, Holiness becometh Thy house, O LORD, for evermore.

95.11: Let the field exult; and all that is therein; Then shall all the trees of the wood sing for joy;
95.10: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;
95.12: Before the LORD, for He is come; For He is come to judge the earth; He will judge the world with righteousness, And the peoples in His faithfulness.
95.1: Sing unto the LORD, bless His name; Proclaim His salvation from day to day.
95.0: O sing unto the LORD a new song; Sing unto the LORD, all the earth.
95.3: For great is the LORD, and highly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods. .
95.2: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvellous works among all the peoples.
95.5: Honour and majesty are before Him; Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
95.4: For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought; But the LORD made the heavens.
95.7: Ascribe unto the LORD the glory due unto His name; Bring an offering, and come into His courts.
95.6: Ascribe unto the LORD, ye kindreds of the peoples, Ascribe unto the LORD glory and strength.
95.9: Say among the nations: 'The LORD reigneth.' The world also is established that it cannot be moved; He will judge the peoples with equity.
95.8: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness; Tremble before Him, all the earth.

94.10: Wherefore I swore in My wrath, That they should not enter into My arest.'
94.1: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving, Let us shout for joy unto Him with psalms.
94.0: O come, let us sing unto the LORD; Let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.
94.3: In whose hand are the depths of the earth; The heights of the mountains are His also.
94.2: For the LORD is a great God, And a great King above all gods;
94.5: O come, let us bow down and bend the knee; Let us kneel before the LORD our Maker;
94.4: The sea is His, and He made it; And His hands formed the dry land.
94.7: 'Harden not your heart, as at Meribah, As in the day of Massah in the wilderness;
94.6: For He is our God, And we are the people of His pasture, and the flock of His hand. To-day, if ye would but hearken to His voice!
94.9: For forty years was I wearied with that generation, And said: It is a people that do err in their heart, And they have not known My ways;
94.8: When your fathers tried Me, Proved Me, even though they saw My work.

97.1: The LORD hath made known His salvation; His righteousness hath He revealed in the sight of the nations.
97.0: A Psalm. O sing unto the LORD a new song; For He hath done marvellous things; His right hand, and His holy arm, hath wrought salvation for Him.
97.3: Shout unto the LORD, all the earth; Break forth and sing for joy, yea, sing praises.
97.2: He hath remembered His mercy and His faithfulness toward the house of Israel; All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
97.5: With trumpets and sound of the horn Shout ye before the King, the LORD.
97.4: Sing praises unto the LORD with the harp; With the harp and the voice of melody.
97.7: Let the floods clap their hands; Let the mountains sing for joy together;
97.6: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; The world, and they that dwell therein;
97.8: Before the LORD, for He is come to judge the earth; He will judge the world with righteousness, And the peoples with equity.

96.11: Be glad in the LORD, ye righteous; And give thanks to His holy name.
96.10: Light is sown for the righteous, And gladness for the upright in heart.
96.1: Clouds and darkness are round about Him; Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
96.0: The LORD reigneth; let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of isles be glad.
96.3: His lightnings lighted up the world; The earth saw, and trembled.
96.2: A fire goeth before Him, And burneth up His adversaries round about.
96.5: The heavens declared His righteousness, And all the peoples saw His glory.
96.4: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
96.7: Zion heard and was glad, And the daughters of Judah rejoiced; Because of Thy judgments, O LORD.
96.6: Ashamed be all they that serve graven images, That boast themselves of things of nought; Bow down to Him, all ye gods.
96.9: O ye that love the LORD, hate evil; He preserveth the souls of His saints; He delivered them out of the hand of the wicked.
96.8: For Thou, LORD, art most high above all the earth; Thou art exalted far above all gods.

11.1: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; For the faithful fail from among the children of men.
11.0: For the Leader; on the Sheminith. A Psalm of David.
11.3: May the LORD cut off all flattering lips, The tongue that speaketh proud things!
11.2: They speak falsehood every one with his neighbour; With flattering lip, and with a double heart, do they speak.
11.5: 'For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, Now will I arise', saith the LORD; 'I will set him in safety at whom they puff.' .
11.4: Who have said: 'Our tongue will we make mighty; Our lips are with us: who is lord over us?'
11.7: Thou wilt keep them, O LORD; Thou wilt preserve us from this generation for ever.
11.6: The words of the LORD are pure words, As silver tried in a crucible on the earth, refined seven times.
11.8: The wicked walk on every side, When vileness is exalted among the sons of men.

10.1: For, lo, the wicked bend the bow, they have made ready their arrow upon the string, that they may shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
10.0: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David. In the LORD have I taken refuge; how say ye to my soul: 'Flee thou! to your mountain, ye birds'?
10.3: The LORD is in His holy temple, the LORD, His throne is in heaven; His eyes behold, His eyelids try, the children of men.
10.2: When the foundations are destroyed, what hath the righteous wrought?
10.5: Upon the wicked He will cause to rain coals; fire and brimstone and burning wind shall be the portion of their cup.
10.4: The LORD trieth the righteous; but the wicked and him that loveth violence His soul hateth.
10.6: For the LORD is righteous, He loveth righteousness; the upright shall behold His face.

13.1: The LORD looked forth from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any man of understanding, that did seek after God.
13.0: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David. The fool hath said in his heart: 'There is no God'; they have dealt corruptly, they have done abominably; there is none that doeth good.
13.3: ’Shall not all the workers of iniquity know it, who eat up My people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD?'
13.2: They are all corrupt, they are together become impure; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
13.5: Ye would put to shame the counsel of the poor, but the LORD is his refuge.
13.4: There are they in great fear; for God is with the righteous generation.
13.6: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! When the LORD turneth the captivity of His people, let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

12.1: How long, O LORD, wilt Thou forget me for ever? How long wilt Thou hide Thy face from me?
12.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
12.3: Behold Thou, and answer me, O LORD my God; Lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
12.2: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart by day? How long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
12.5: But as for me, in Thy mercy do I trust; My heart shall rejoice in Thy salvation. I will sing unto the LORD, Because He hath dealt bountifully with me.
12.4: Lest mine enemy say: 'I have prevailed against him'; Lest mine adversaries rejoice when I am moved.

15.10: Thou makest me to know the path of life; In Thy presence is fulness of joy, In Thy right hand bliss for evermore.
15.1: I have said unto the LORD: 'Thou art my Lord; I have no good but in Thee';
15.0: Michtam of David. Keep me, O God; for I have taken refuge in Thee.
15.3: Let the idols of them be multiplied that make suit unto another; Their drink-offerings of blood will I not offer, Nor take their names upon my lips.
15.2: As for the holy that are in the earth, They are the excellent in whom is all my delight.
15.5: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; Yea, I have a goodly heritage.
15.4: O LORD, the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup, Thou maintainest my lot.
15.7: I have set the LORD always before me; Surely He is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
15.6: I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel; Yea, in the night seasons my reins instruct me.
15.9: For Thou wilt not abandon my soul to the nether-world; Neither wilt Thou suffer Thy godly one to see the pit.
15.8: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth; my flesh also dwelleth in safety;

14.1: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, And speaketh truth in his heart;
14.0: A Psalm of David. LORD, who shall sojourn in Thy tabernacle? Who shall dwell upon Thy holy mountain?
14.3: In whose eyes a vile person is despised, But he honoureth them that fear the LORD; He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not;
14.2: That hath no slander upon his tongue, Nor doeth evil to his fellow, Nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour;
14.4: He that putteth not out his money on interest, Nor taketh a bribe against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.

17.42: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind; I did cast them out as the mire of the streets.
17.48: He delivereth me from mine enemies; yea, Thou liftest me up above them that rise up against me; Thou deliverest me from the violent man.
17.43: Thou hast delivered me from the contentions of the people; Thou hast made me the head of the nations; a people whom I have not known serve me.
17.49: Therefore I will give thanks unto Thee, O LORD, among the nations, and will sing praises unto Thy name.
17.24: Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in His eyes.
17.25: With the merciful Thou dost show Thyself merciful, with the upright man Thou dost show Thyself upright;
17.26: With the pure Thou dost show Thyself pure; and with the crooked Thou dost show Thyself subtle.
17.27: For Thou dost save the afflicted people; but the haughty eyes Thou dost humble.
17.20: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath He recompensed me. .
17.21: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
17.22: For all His ordinances were before me, and I put not away His statutes from me.
17.23: And I was single-hearted with Him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.
17.46: The LORD liveth, and blessed be my Rock; and exalted be the God of my salvation;
17.47: Even the God that executeth vengeance for me, and subdueth peoples under me.
17.44: As soon as they hear of me, they obey me; The sons of the stranger dwindle away before me.
17.45: The sons of the stranger fade away, and come trembling out of their close places.
17.28: For Thou dost light my lamp; the LORD my God doth lighten my darkness.
17.29: For by Thee I run upon a troop; and by my God do I scale a wall.
17.40: Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me, and I did cut off them that hate me.
17.41: They cried, but there was none to save; even unto the LORD, but He answered them not.
17.1: And he said: I love thee, O LORD, my strength.
17.0: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David the servant of the LORD, who spoke unto the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul;
17.3: Praised, I cry, is the LORD, and I am saved from mine enemies. .
17.2: The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; My God, my rock, in Him I take refuge; my shield, and my horn of salvation, my high tower.
17.5: The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of Death confronted me.
17.4: The cords of Death compassed me, and the floods of Belial assailed me.
17.7: Then the earth did shake and quake, the foundations also of the mountains did tremble; they were shaken, because He was wroth.
17.6: In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried unto my God; out of His temple He heard my voice, and my cry came before Him unto His ears.
17.9: He bowed the heavens also, and came down; and thick darkness was under His feet.
17.8: Smoke arose up in His nostrils, and fire out of His mouth did devour; coals flamed forth from Him.
17.39: For Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle; Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
17.38: I have smitten them through, so that they are not able to rise; they are fallen under my feet.
17.11: He made darkness His hiding-place, His pavilion round about Him; darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
17.10: And He rode upon a cherub, and did fly; yea, He did swoop down upon the wings of the wind.
17.13: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Most High gave forth His voice; hailstones and coals of fire.
17.12: At the brightness before Him, there passed through His thick clouds Hailstones and coals of fire.
17.15: And the channels of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were laid bare, at Thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of Thy nostrils.
17.14: And He sent out His arrows, and scattered them; and He shot forth lightnings, and discomfited them.
17.17: He delivered me from mine enemy most strong, and from them that hated me, for they were too mighty for me.
17.16: He sent from on high, He took me; He drew me out of many waters.
17.19: He brought me forth also into a large place; He delivered me, because He delighted in me.
17.18: They confronted me in the day of my calamity; but the LORD was a stay unto me.
17.31: For who is God, save the LORD? And who is a Rock, except our God?
17.30: As for God, His way is perfect; the word of the LORD is tried; He is a shield unto all them that take refuge in Him.
17.37: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them; neither did I turn back till they were consumed.
17.36: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and my feet have not slipped.
17.35: Thou hast also given me Thy shield of salvation, and Thy right hand hath holden me up; and Thy condescension hath made me great.
17.34: Who traineth my hands for war, so that mine arms do bend a bow of brass.
17.33: Who maketh my feet like hinds', and setteth me upon my high places;
17.32: The God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way straight;
17.50: Great salvation giveth He to His king; and showeth mercy to His anointed, To David and to his seed, for evermore.

16.11: He is like a lion that is eager to tear in pieces, And like a young lion lurking in secret places.
16.10: At our every step they have now encompassed us; They set their eyes to cast us down to the earth.
16.13: From men, by Thy hand, O LORD, From men of the world, whose portion is in this life, And whose belly Thou fillest with Thy treasure; Who have children in plenty, And leave their abundance to their babes.
16.12: Arise, O LORD, confront him, cast him down; Deliver my soul from the wicked, by Thy sword;
16.14: As for me, I shall behold Thy face in righteousness; I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with Thy likeness.
16.1: Let my judgment come forth from Thy presence; Let Thine eyes behold equity.
16.0: A Prayer of David. Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry; Give ear unto my prayer from lips without deceit.
16.3: As for the doings of men, by the word of Thy lips I have kept me from the ways of the violent.
16.2: Thou hast tried my heart, Thou hast visited it in the night; Thou hast tested me, and Thou findest not That I had a thought which should not pass my mouth.
16.5: As for me, I call upon Thee, for Thou wilt answer me, O God; Incline Thine ear unto me, hear my speech.
16.4: My steps have held fast to Thy paths, My feet have not slipped.
16.7: Keep me as the apple of the eye, Hide me in the shadow of Thy wings,
16.6: Make passing great Thy mercies, O Thou that savest by Thy right hand From assailants them that take refuge in Thee.
16.9: Their gross heart they have shut tight, With their mouth they speak proudly.
16.8: From the wicked that oppress, My deadly enemies, that compass me about.

19.1: The LORD answer thee in the day of trouble; The name of the God of Jacob set thee up on high;
19.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
19.3: Receive the memorial of all thy meal-offerings, And accept the fat of thy burnt-sacrifice; Selah
19.2: Send forth thy help from the sanctuary, And support thee out of Zion;
19.5: We will shout for joy in thy victory, And in the name of our God we will set up our standards; The LORD fulfil all thy petitions.
19.4: Grant thee according to thine own heart, And fulfil all thy counsel.
19.7: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses; But we will make mention of the name of the LORD our God.
19.6: Now know I that the LORD saveth His anointed; He will answer him from His holy heaven With the mighty acts of His saving right hand.
19.9: Save, LORD; Let the King answer us in the day that we call.
19.8: They are bowed down and fallen; But we are risen, and stand upright.

18.11: Moreover by them is Thy servant warned; in keeping of them there is great reward.
18.10: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold; sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
18.13: Keep back Thy servant also from presumptuous sins, that they may not have dominion over me; then shall I be faultless, and I shall be clear from great transgression.
18.12: Who can discern his errors? Clear Thou me from hidden faults.
18.14: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable before Thee, O LORD, my Rock, and my Redeemer.
18.1: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament showeth His handiwork;
18.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
18.3: There is no speech, there are no words, neither is their voice heard.
18.2: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night revealeth knowledge;
18.5: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run his course.
18.4: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath He set a tent for the sun,
18.7: The law of the LORD is perfect, restoring the soul; the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple. .
18.6: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it; and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.
18.9: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever; the ordinances of the LORD are true, they are righteous altogether;
18.8: The precepts of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.

117.24: We beseech Thee, O LORD, save now! We beseech Thee, O LORD, make us now to prosper!
117.25: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD; We bless you out of the house of the LORD.
117.26: The LORD is God, and hath given us light; Order the festival procession with boughs, even unto the horns of the altar.
117.27: Thou art my God, and I will give thanks unto Thee; Thou art my God, I will exalt Thee.
117.20: I will give thanks unto Thee, for Thou hast answered me, And art become my salvation.
117.21: The stone which the builders rejected Is become the chief corner-stone.
117.22: This is the LORD’S doing; It is marvellous in our eyes.
117.23: This is the day which the LORD hath made; We will rejoice and be glad in it.
117.28: O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, For His mercy endureth for ever.
117.1: So let Israel now say, For His mercy endureth for ever,
117.0: 'O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, For His mercy endureth for ever.
117.3: So let them now that fear the LORD say, For His mercy endureth for ever.
117.2: So let the house of Aaron now say, For His mercy endureth for ever.
117.5: The LORD is for me; I will not fear; What can man do unto me?
117.4: Out of my straits I called upon the LORD; He answered me with great enlargement.
117.7: It is better to take refuge in the LORD Than to trust in man.
117.6: The LORD is for me as my helper; And I shall gaze upon them that hate me.
117.9: All nations compass me about; Verily, in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
117.8: It is better to take refuge in the LORD Than to trust in princes.
117.11: They compass me about like bees; They are quenched as the fire of thorns; Verily, in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
117.10: They compass me about, yea, they compass me about; Verily, in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.
117.13: The LORD is my strength and song; And He is become my salvation.
117.12: Thou didst thrust sore at me that I might fall; But the LORD helped me.
117.15: The right hand of the LORD is exalted; The right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
117.14: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous; The right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
117.17: The LORD hath chastened me sore; But He hath not given me over unto death.
117.16: I shall not die, but live, And declare the works of the LORD.
117.19: This is the gate of the LORD; The righteous shall enter into it.
117.18: Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will enter into them, I will give thanks unto the LORD.

116.1: For His mercy is great toward us; And the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Hallelujah.
116.0: O praise the LORD, all ye nations; Laud Him, all ye peoples.

48.11: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, And their dwelling-places to all generations; They call their lands after their own names.
48.10: For he seeth that wise men die, The fool and the brutish together perish, And leave their wealth to others.
48.13: This is the way of them that are foolish, and of those who after them approve their sayings. Selah
48.12: But man abideth not in honour; He is like the beasts that perish.
48.15: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the nether-world; For He shall receive me. Selah
48.14: Like sheep they are appointed for the nether-world; death shall be their shepherd; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; And their form shall be for the nether-world to wear away, That there be no habitation for it.
48.17: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away; His wealth shall not descend after him.
48.16: Be not thou afraid when one waxeth rich, When the wealth of his house is increased;
48.19: It shall go to the generation of his fathers; They shall never see the light. .
48.18: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: 'Men will praise thee, when thou shalt do well to thyself';
48.20: Man that is in honour understandeth not; He is like the beasts that perish.
48.1: Hear this, all ye peoples; Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world,
48.0: For the Leader; a Psalm for the sons of Korah.
48.3: My mouth shall speak wisdom, and the meditation of my heart shall be understanding.
48.2: Both low and high, Rich and poor together.
48.5: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my supplanters compasseth me about,
48.4: I will incline mine ear to a parable; I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
48.7: No man can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him—
48.6: Of them that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches?
48.9: That he should still live always, that he should not see the pit.
48.8: For too costly is the redemption of their soul, and must be let alone for ever—

49.20: These things hast thou done, and should I have kept silence? Thou hadst thought that I was altogether such a one as thyself; but I will reprove thee, and set the cause before thine eyes.
49.21: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear in pieces, and there be none to deliver.
49.22: Whoso offereth the sacrifice of thanksgiving honoureth Me; and to him that ordereth his way aright Will I show the salvation of God.'
49.1: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined forth.
49.0: A Psalm of Asaph. God, God, the LORD, hath spoken, and called the earth From the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
49.3: He calleth to the heavens above, and to the earth, that He may judge His people:
49.2: Our God cometh, and doth not keep silence; a fire devoureth before Him, And round about Him it stormeth mightily.
49.5: And the heavens declare His righteousness; for God, He is judge. Selah
49.4: 'Gather My saints together unto Me; those that have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.'
49.7: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices; and thy burnt-offerings are continually before Me.
49.6: 'Hear, O My people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: God, thy God, am I.
49.9: For every beast of the forest is Mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
49.8: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds.
49.11: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the world is Mine, and the fulness thereof.
49.10: I know all the fowls of the mountains; and the wild beasts of the field are Mine.
49.13: Offer unto God the sacrifice of thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the Most High;
49.12: Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
49.15: But unto the wicked God saith: 'What hast thou to do to declare My statutes, And that thou hast taken My covenant in thy mouth?
49.14: And call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt honour Me.'
49.17: When thou sawest a thief, thou hadst company with him, and with adulterers was thy portion.
49.16: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest My words behind thee.
49.19: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; Thou slanderest thine own mother's son.
49.18: Thou hast let loose thy mouth for evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit. .

46.1: O clap your hands, all ye peoples; shout unto God with the voice of triumph. .
46.0: For the Leader; a Psalm for the sons of Korah.
46.3: He subdueth peoples under us, and nations under our feet.
46.2: For the LORD is most high, awful; a great King over all the earth.
46.5: God is gone up amidst shouting, the LORD amidst the sound of the horn.
46.4: He chooseth our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob whom He loveth. Selah
46.7: For God is the King of all the earth; sing ye praises in a skilful song.
46.6: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises unto our King, sing praises.
46.9: The princes of the peoples are gathered together, the people of the God of Abraham; for unto God belong the shields of the earth; He is greatly exalted.
46.8: God reigneth over the nations; God sitteth upon His holy throne.

47.11: Let mount Zion be glad, Let the daughters of Judah rejoice, Because of Thy judgments.
47.10: As is Thy name, O God, So is Thy praise unto the ends of the earth; Thy right hand is full of righteousness.
47.13: Mark ye well her ramparts, Traverse her palaces; That ye may tell it to the generation following. .
47.12: Walk about Zion, and go round about her; Count the towers thereof.
47.14: For such is God, our God, for ever and ever; He will guide us eternally.
47.1: Great is the LORD, and highly to be praised, In the city of our God, His holy mountain,
47.0: A Song; a Psalm of the sons of Korah.
47.3: God in her palaces Hath made Himself known for a stronghold.
47.2: Fair in situation, the joy of the whole earth; Even mount Zion, the uttermost parts of the north, The city of the great King.
47.5: They saw, straightway they were amazed; They were affrighted, they hasted away.
47.4: For, lo, the kings assembled themselves, They came onward together.
47.7: With the east wind Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish.
47.6: Trembling took hold of them there, Pangs, as of a woman in travail.
47.9: We have thought on Thy lovingkindness, O God, In the midst of Thy temple.
47.8: As we have heard, so have we seen In the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God— God establish it for ever. Selah

44.11: So shall the king desire thy beauty; For he is thy lord; and do homage unto him. .
44.10: 'Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; Forget also thine own people, and thy father's house;
44.13: All glorious is the king's daughter within the palace; Her raiment is of chequer work inwrought with gold.
44.12: And, O daughter of Tyre, the richest of the people Shall entreat thy favour with a gift.'
44.15: They shall be led with gladness and rejoicing; They shall enter into the king's palace.
44.14: She shall be led unto the king on richly woven stuff; The virgins her companions in her train being brought unto thee.
44.17: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations; Therefore shall the peoples praise thee for ever and ever.
44.16: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy sons, Whom thou shalt make princes in all the land.
44.1: My heart overfloweth with a goodly matter; I say: 'My work is concerning a king'; My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
44.0: For the Leader; upon Shoshannim; [a Psalm] of the sons of Korah. Maschil. A Song of loves.
44.3: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, Thy glory and thy majesty.
44.2: Thou art fairer than the children of men; Grace is poured upon thy lips; Therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
44.5: Thine arrows are sharp— The peoples fall under thee— [They sink] into the heart of the king's enemies.
44.4: And in thy majesty prosper, ride on, In behalf of truth and meekness and righteousness; And let thy right hand teach thee tremendous things.
44.7: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness; Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee With the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
44.6: Thy throne given of God is for ever and ever; A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
44.9: Kings' daughters are among thy favourites; At thy right hand doth stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
44.8: Myrrh, and aloes, and cassia are all thy garments; Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad.

45.11: The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our high tower. Selah
45.10: 'Let be, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.'
45.1: God is our refuge and strength, A very present help in trouble.
45.0: For the Leader; [a Psalm] of the sons of Korah; upon Alamoth. A Song.
45.3: Though the waters thereof roar and foam, Though the mountains shake at the swelling thereof. Selah
45.2: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth do change, And though the mountains be moved into the heart of the seas;
45.5: God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God shall help her, at the approach of morning.
45.4: There is a river, the streams whereof make glad the city of God, The holiest dwelling-place of the Most High.
45.7: The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our high tower. Selah
45.6: Nations were in tumult, kingdoms were moved; He uttered His voice, the earth melted.
45.9: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; He breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; He burneth the chariots in the fire.
45.8: Come, behold the works of the LORD, Who hath made desolations in the earth.

42.1: For Thou art the God of my strength; why hast Thou cast me off? Why go I mourning under the oppression of the enemy?
42.0: Be Thou my judge, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
42.3: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God, my exceeding joy; And praise Thee upon the harp, O God, my God.
42.2: O send out Thy light and Thy truth; let them lead me; Let them bring me unto Thy holy mountain, and to Thy dwelling-places.
42.4: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? And why moanest thou within me? Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise Him, The salvation of my countenance, and my God.

43.24: Wherefore hidest Thou Thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
43.25: For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
43.26: Arise for our help, and redeem us for Thy mercy's sake.
43.20: If we had forgotten the name of our God, or spread forth our hands to a strange god; .
43.21: Would not God search this out? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.
43.22: Nay, but for Thy sake are we killed all the day; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
43.23: Awake, why sleepest Thou, O Lord? Arouse Thyself, cast not off for ever.
43.1: O God, we have heard with our ears, our fathers have told us; a work Thou didst in their days, in the days of old.
43.0: For the Leader; [a Psalm] of the sons of Korah. Maschil.
43.3: For not by their own sword did they get the land in possession, Neither did their own arm save them; but Thy right hand, and Thine arm, and the light of Thy countenance, because Thou wast favourable unto them.
43.2: Thou with Thy hand didst drive out the nations, and didst plant them in; Thou didst break the peoples, and didst spread them abroad.
43.5: Through Thee do we push down our adversaries; through Thy name do we tread them under that rise up against us.
43.4: Thou art my King, O God; command the salvation of Jacob.
43.7: But Thou hast saved us from our adversaries, and hast put them to shame that hate us.
43.6: For I trust not in my bow, neither can my sword save me.
43.9: Yet Thou hast cast off, and brought us to confusion; and goest not forth with our hosts.
43.8: In God have we gloried all the day, and we will give thanks unto Thy name for ever. Selah
43.11: Thou hast given us like sheep to be eaten; and hast scattered us among the nations.
43.10: Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary; and they that hate us spoil at their will.
43.13: Thou makest us a taunt to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
43.12: Thou sellest Thy people for small gain, and hast not set their prices high.
43.15: All the day is my confusion before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
43.14: Thou makest us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the peoples.
43.17: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten Thee, neither have we been false to Thy covenant.
43.16: For the voice of him that taunteth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and the revengeful.
43.19: Though Thou hast crushed us into a place of jackals, and covered us with the shadow of death.
43.18: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from Thy path;

40.11: By this I know that Thou delightest in me, that mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
40.10: But Thou, O LORD, be gracious unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.
40.13: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
40.12: And as for me, Thou upholdest me because of mine integrity, and settest me before Thy face for ever.
40.1: Happy is he that considereth the poor; the LORD will deliver him in the day of evil.
40.0: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.
40.3: The LORD support him upon the bed of illness; mayest Thou turn all his lying down in his sickness.
40.2: The LORD preserve him, and keep him alive, let him be called happy in the land; and deliver not Thou him unto the greed of his enemies.
40.5: Mine enemies speak evil of me: 'When shall he die, and his name perish?'
40.4: As for me, I said: 'O LORD, be gracious unto me; heal my soul; for I have sinned against Thee.'
40.7: All that hate me whisper together against me, against me do they devise my hurt:
40.6: And if one come to see me, he speaketh falsehood; His heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he speaketh of it.
40.9: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, who did eat of my bread, Hath lifted up his heel against me.
40.8: 'An evil thing cleaveth fast unto him; and now that he lieth, he shall rise up no more.'

41.11: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? And why moanest thou within me? Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise Him, the salvation of my countenance, and my God.
41.10: As with a crushing in my bones, mine adversaries taunt me; while they say unto me all the day: 'Where is Thy God?'
41.1: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after Thee, O God.
41.0: For the Leader; Maschil of the sons of Korah.
41.3: My tears have been my food day and night, while they say unto me all the day: 'Where is Thy God?'
41.2: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: 'When shall I come and appear before God?'
41.5: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? And why moanest thou within me? Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise Him for the salvation of His countenance.
41.4: These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me, how I passed on with the throng, and led them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping holyday.
41.7: Deep calleth unto deep at the voice of Thy cataracts; all Thy waves and Thy billows are gone over me.
41.6: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; therefore do I remember Thee from the land of Jordan, and the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.
41.9: I will say unto God my Rock: 'Why hast Thou forgotten me? Why go I mourning under the oppression of the enemy?'
41.8: By day the LORD will command His lovingkindness, and in the night His song shall be with me, even a prayer unto the God of my life.

1.11: Do homage in purity, lest He be angry, and ye perish in the way, when suddenly His wrath is kindled. Happy are all they that take refuge in Him.
1.10: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
1.1: The kings of the earth stand up, And the rulers take counsel together, Against the LORD, and against His anointed:
1.0: Why are the nations in an uproar? And why do the peoples mutter in vain?
1.3: He that sitteth in heaven laugheth, the Lord hath them in derision.
1.2: 'Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.'
1.5: 'Truly it is I that have established My king upon Zion, My holy mountain.'
1.4: Then will He speak unto them in His wrath, and affright them in His sore displeasure:
1.7: Ask of Me, and I will give the nations for thine inheritance, and the ends of the earth for thy possession.
1.6: I will tell of the decree: The LORD said unto me: 'Thou art My son, this day have I begotten thee.
1.9: Now therefore, O ye kings, be wise; be admonished, ye judges of the earth.
1.8: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; Thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter's vessel.'

5.10: All mine enemies shall be ashamed and sore affrighted; They shall turn back, they shall be ashamed suddenly.
5.1: O LORD, rebuke me not in Thine anger, Neither chasten me in Thy wrath.
5.0: For the Leader; with string-music; on the Sheminith. A Psalm of David.
5.3: My soul also is sore affrighted; And Thou, O LORD, how long?
5.2: Be gracious unto me, O LORD, for I languish away; Heal me, O LORD, for my bones are affrighted.
5.5: For in death there is no remembrance of Thee; In the nether-world who will give Thee thanks?
5.4: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul; Save me for Thy mercy's sake.
5.7: Mine eye is dimmed because of vexation; It waxeth old because of all mine adversaries.
5.6: I am weary with my groaning; Every night make I my bed to swim; I melt away my couch with my tears.
5.9: The LORD hath heard my supplication; The LORD receiveth my prayer.
5.8: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; For the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.

9.11: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up Thy hand; Forget not the humble.
9.10: He hath said in his heart: 'God hath forgotten; He hideth His face; He will never see.'
9.13: Thou hast seen; for Thou beholdest trouble and vexation, to requite them with Thy hand; Unto Thee the helpless committeth himself; Thou hast been the helper of the fatherless.
9.12: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God, And say in his heart: 'Thou wilt not require'?
9.15: The LORD is King for ever and ever; The nations are perished out of His land.
9.14: Break Thou the arm of the wicked; And as for the evil man, search out his wickedness, till none be found.
9.17: To right the fatherless and the oppressed, That man who is of the earth may be terrible no more.
9.16: LORD, Thou hast heard the desire of the humble: Thou wilt direct their heart, Thou wilt cause Thine ear to attend;
9.1: Through the pride of the wicked the poor is hotly pursued, They are taken in the devices that they have imagined.
9.0: Why standest Thou afar off, O LORD? Why hidest Thou Thyself in times of trouble?
9.3: The wicked, in the pride of his countenance [, saith]: 'He will not require'; All his thoughts are: 'There is no God.'
9.2: For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, And the covetous vaunteth himself, though he contemn the LORD.
9.5: He saith in his heart: 'I shall not be moved, I who to all generations shall not be in adversity.'
9.4: His ways prosper at all times; Thy judgments are far above out of his sight; As for all his adversaries, he puffeth at them.
9.7: He sitteth in the lurking-places of the villages; In secret places doth he slay the innocent; His eyes are on the watch for the helpless.
9.6: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and oppression; Under his tongue is mischief and iniquity.
9.9: He croucheth, he boweth down, And the helpless fall into his mighty claws.
9.8: He lieth in wait in a secret place as a lion in his lair, He lieth in wait to catch the poor; He doth catch the poor, when he draweth him up in his net.

146.11: Glorify the LORD, O Jerusalem; Praise thy God, O Zion.
146.10: The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear Him, In those that wait for His mercy.
146.13: He maketh thy borders peace; He giveth thee in plenty the fat of wheat.
146.12: For He hath made strong the bars of thy gates; He hath blessed thy children within thee.
146.15: He giveth snow like wool; He scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.
146.14: He sendeth out His commandment upon earth; His word runneth very swiftly.
146.17: He sendeth forth His word, and melteth them; He causeth His wind to blow, and the waters flow.
146.16: He casteth forth His ice like crumbs; Who can stand before His cold?
146.19: He hath not dealt so with any nation; And as for His ordinances, they have not known them. Hallelujah.
146.18: He declareth His word unto Jacob, His statutes and His ordinances unto Israel.
146.1: The LORD doth build up Jerusalem, He gathereth together the dispersed of Israel;
146.0: Hallelujah; For it is good to sing praises unto our God; For it is pleasant, and praise is comely.
146.3: He counteth the number of the stars; He giveth them all their names.
146.2: Who healeth the broken in heart, And bindeth up their wounds.
146.5: The LORD upholdeth the humble; He bringeth the wicked down to the ground.
146.4: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power; His understanding is infinite.
146.7: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, Who prepareth rain for the earth, Who maketh the mountains to spring with grass.
146.6: Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving, Sing praises upon the harp unto our God;
146.9: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse; He taketh no pleasure in the legs of a man.
146.8: He giveth to the beast his food, And to the young ravens which cry.

147.11: Both young men and maidens, Old men and children;
147.10: Kings of the earth and all peoples, Princes and all judges of the earth;
147.13: And He hath lifted up a horn for His people, A praise for all His saints, Even for the children of Israel, a people near unto Him. Hallelujah.
147.12: Let them praise the name of the LORD, For His name alone is exalted; His glory is above the earth and heaven.
147.1: Praise ye Him, all His angels; Praise ye Him, all His hosts.
147.0: Hallelujah. Praise ye the LORD from the  heavens; Praise Him in the heights.
147.3: Praise Him, ye heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens.
147.2: Praise ye Him, sun and moon; Praise Him, all ye stars of light.
147.5: He hath also established them for ever and ever; He hath made a decree which shall not be transgressed.
147.4: Let them praise the name of the LORD; For He commanded, and they were created.
147.7: Fire and hail, snow and vapour, Stormy wind, fulfilling His word;
147.6: Praise the LORD from the earth, Ye sea-monsters, and all deeps;
147.9: Beasts and all cattle, Creeping things and winged fowl;
147.8: Mountains and all hills, Fruitful trees and all cedars;

144.11: To make known to the sons of men His mighty acts, And the glory of the majesty of His kingdom.
144.10: They shall speak of the glory of Thy kingdom, And talk of Thy might;
144.13: The LORD upholdeth all that fall, And raiseth up all those that are bowed down.
144.12: Thy kingdom is a kingdom for all ages, And Thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.
144.15: Thou openest Thy hand, And satisfiest every living thing with favour.
144.14: The eyes of all wait for Thee, And Thou givest them their food in due season.
144.17: The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon Him, To all that call upon Him in truth.
144.16: The LORD is righteous in all His ways, And gracious in all His works.
144.19: The LORD preserveth all them that love Him; But all the wicked will He destroy.
144.18: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear Him; He also will hear their cry, and will save them.
144.20: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD; And let all flesh bless His holy name for ever and ever.
144.1: Every day will I bless Thee; And I will praise Thy name for ever and ever.
144.0: [A Psalm of] praise; of David. I will extol Thee, my God, O King; And I will bless Thy name for ever and ever.
144.3: One generation shall laud Thy works to another, And shall declare Thy mighty acts.
144.2: Great is the LORD, and highly to be praised; And His greatness is unsearchable.
144.5: And men shall speak of the might of Thy tremendous acts; And I will tell of Thy greatness.
144.4: The glorious splendour of Thy majesty, And Thy wondrous works, will I rehearse.
144.7: The LORD is gracious, and full of compassion; Slow to anger, and of great mercy.
144.6: They shall utter the fame of Thy great goodness, And shall sing of Thy righteousness.
144.9: All Thy works shall praise Thee, O LORD; And Thy saints shall bless Thee.
144.8: The LORD is good to all;  And His tender mercies are over all His works.

145.1: I will praise the LORD while I live; I will sing praises unto my God while I have my being.
145.0: Hallelujah. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
145.3: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his dust; In that very day his thoughts perish.
145.2: Put not your trust in princes, Nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.
145.5: Who made heaven and earth, The sea, and all that in them is; Who keepeth truth for ever;
145.4: Happy is he whose help is the God of Jacob, Whose hope is in the LORD his God,
145.7: The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind; The LORD raiseth up them that are bowed down; The LORD loveth the righteous;
145.6: Who executeth justice for the oppressed; Who giveth bread to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners;
145.9: The LORD will reign for ever, Thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Hallelujah.
145.8: The LORD preserveth the strangers; He upholdeth the fatherless and the widow; But the way of the wicked He maketh crooked.

142.11: And in Thy mercy cut off mine enemies, And destroy all them that harass my soul; For I am Thy servant.
142.10: For Thy name's sake, O LORD, quicken me; In Thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
142.1: And enter not into judgment with Thy servant; For in Thy sight shall no man living be justified.
142.0: A Psalm of David. O LORD, hear my prayer, give ear to my supplications; In Thy faithfulness answer me, and in Thy righteousness.
142.3: And my spirit fainteth within me; My heart within me is appalled.
142.2: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; He hath crushed my life down to the ground; He hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
142.5: I spread forth my hands unto Thee; My soul [thirsteth] after Thee, as a weary land. Selah
142.4: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Thy doing; I muse on the work of Thy hands.
142.7: Cause me to hear Thy lovingkindness in the morning, For in Thee do I trust; Cause me to know the way wherein I should walk, For unto Thee have I lifted up my soul.
142.6: Answer me speedily, O LORD, My spirit faileth; Hide not Thy face from me; Lest I become like them that go down into the pit.
142.9: Teach me to do Thy will, For Thou art my God; Let Thy good spirit Lead me in an even land.
142.8: Deliver me from mine enemies, O LORD; With Thee have I hidden myself.

143.11: We whose sons are as plants grown up in their youth; Whose daughters are as corner-pillars carved after the fashion of a palace;
143.10: Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hand of strangers, Whose mouth speaketh falsehood, And their right hand is a right hand of lying.
143.13: Whose oxen are well laden; With no breach, and no going forth, And no outcry in our broad places;
143.12: Whose garners are full, affording all manner of store; Whose sheep increase by thousands and ten thousands in our fields;
143.14: Happy is the people that is in such a case. Yea, happy is the people whose God is the LORD.
143.1: My lovingkindness, and my fortress, My high tower, and my deliverer; My shield, and He in whom I take refuge; Who subdueth my people under me.
143.0: [A Psalm] of David. Blessed be the LORD my Rock, Who traineth my hands for war, And my fingers for battle;
143.3: Man is like unto a breath; His days are as a shadow that passeth away.
143.2: LORD, what is man, that Thou takest knowledge of him? Or the son of man, that Thou makest account of him?
143.5: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them; Send out Thine arrows, and discomfit them.
143.4: O LORD, bow Thy heavens, and come down; Touch the mountains, that they may smoke.
143.7: Whose mouth speaketh falsehood, And their right hand is a right hand of lying.
143.6: Stretch forth Thy hands from on high; Rescue me, and deliver me out of many waters, Out of the hand of strangers;
143.9: Who givest salvation unto kings, Who rescuest David Thy servant from the hurtful sword.
143.8: O God, I will sing a new song unto Thee, Upon a psaltery of ten strings will I sing praises unto Thee;

140.1: Let my prayer be set forth as incense before Thee, The lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
140.0: A Psalm of David. LORD, I have called Thee; make haste unto me; Give ear unto my voice, when I call unto Thee.
140.3: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, To be occupied in deeds of wickedness With men that work iniquity; And let me not eat of their dainties.
140.2: Set a guard, O LORD, to my mouth; Keep watch at the door of my lips.
140.5: Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock; And they shall hear my words, that they are sweet.
140.4: Let the righteous smite me in kindness, and correct me; Oil so choice let not my head refuse; For still is my prayer because of their wickedness.
140.7: For mine eyes are unto Thee, O GOD the Lord; In Thee have I taken refuge, O pour not out my soul.
140.6: As when one cleaveth and breaketh up the earth, Our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth.
140.9: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, Whilst I withal escape.
140.8: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, And from the gins of the workers of iniquity.

141.1: With my voice I cry unto the LORD; With my voice I make supplication unto the LORD.
141.0: Maschil of David, when he was in the cave; a Prayer.
141.3: When my spirit fainteth within me— Thou knowest my path— In the way wherein I walk Have they hidden a snare for me.
141.2: I pour out my complaint before Him, I declare before Him my trouble;
141.5: I have cried unto Thee, O LORD; I have said: 'Thou art my refuge, My portion in the land of the living.'
141.4: Look on my right hand, and see, For there is no man that knoweth me; I have no way to flee; No man careth for my soul.
141.7: Bring my soul out of prison, That I may give thanks unto Thy name; The righteous shall crown themselves because of me; For Thou wilt deal bountifully with me.
141.6: Attend unto my cry; For I am brought very low; Deliver me from my persecutors; For they are too strong for me.

148.1: Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
148.0: Hallelujah. Sing unto the LORD a new song, And His praise in the assembly of the saints.
148.3: For the LORD taketh pleasure in His people; He adorneth the humble with salvation.
148.2: Let them praise His name in the dance; Let them sing praises unto Him with the timbrel and harp.
148.5: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, And a two-edged sword in their hand;
148.4: Let the saints exult in glory; Let them sing for joy upon their beds.
148.7: To bind their kings with chains, And their nobles with fetters of iron;

77.56: But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers; They were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

77.1: I will open my mouth with a parable; I will utter dark sayings concerning days of old;

77.3: We will not hide from their children, Telling to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, And His strength, and His wondrous works that He hath done. .
77.2: That which we have heard and known, And our fathers have told us,

77.65: And He smote His adversaries backward; He put upon them a perpetual reproach.

77.71: So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart; And lead them by the skilfulness of his hands.

77.59: And He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, The tent which He had made to dwell among men;

77.11: Marvellous things did He in the sight of their fathers, In the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

77.55: Yet they tried and provoked God, the Most High, And kept not His testimonies;

76.11: I will make mention of the deeds of the LORD; Yea, I will remember Thy wonders of old.

75.11: Vow, and pay unto the LORD your God; Let all that are round about Him bring presents unto Him that is to be feared;

73.20: O let not the oppressed turn back in confusion; Let the poor and needy praise Thy name.

73.22: Forget not the voice of Thine adversaries, The tumult of those that rise up against Thee which ascendeth continually.
73.1: Remember Thy congregation, which Thou hast gotten of old, Which Thou hast redeemed to be the tribe of Thine inheritance; And mount Zion, wherein Thou hast dwelt.
73.0: Maschil of Asaph. Why, O God, hast Thou cast us off for ever? Why doth Thine anger smoke against the flock of Thy pasture?
73.3: Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of Thy meeting-place; They have set up their own signs for signs.
73.2: Lift up Thy steps because of the perpetual ruins, Even all the evil that the enemy hath done in the sanctuary.
73.5: And now all the carved work thereof together They strike down with hatchet and hammers.
73.4: It seemed as when men wield upwards Axes in a thicket of trees.

73.9: How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy blaspheme Thy name for ever?

73.11: Yet God is my King of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.

73.12: Thou didst break the sea in pieces by Thy strength; Thou didst shatter the heads of the sea-monsters in the waters.
73.15: Thine is the day, Thine also the night; Thou hast established luminary and sun.

73.17: Remember this, how the enemy hath reproached the LORD, And how a base people have blasphemed Thy name.
73.16: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth; Thou hast made summer and winter.

72.24: Whom have I in heaven but Thee? And beside Thee I desire none upon earth.

72.26: For, lo, they that go far from Thee shall perish; Thou dost destroy all them that go astray from Thee.
72.27: But as for me, the nearness of God is my good; I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, That I may tell of all Thy works.
72.20: For my heart was in a ferment, And I was pricked in my reins. .
72.21: But I was brutish, and ignorant; I was as a beast before Thee.
72.22: Nevertheless I am continually with Thee; Thou holdest my right hand.
72.23: Thou wilt guide me with Thy counsel, And afterward receive me with glory.
72.1: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
72.0: A Psalm of Asaph. Surely God is good to Israel, even to such as are pure in heart.
72.3: For there are no pangs at their death, and their body is sound.
72.2: For I was envious at the arrogant, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

72.4: In the trouble of man they are not; neither are they plagued like men.
72.7: They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression; they speak as if there were none on high.
72.6: Their eyes stand forth from fatness; they are gone beyond the imaginations of their heart.

72.15: And when I pondered how I might know this, It was wearisome in mine eyes;
72.14: If I had said: 'I will speak thus', Behold, I had been faithless to the generation of Thy children.
72.17: Surely Thou settest them in slippery places; Thou hurlest them down to utter ruin.

71.11: For he will deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.

71.17: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, Who only doeth wondrous things;
71.16: May his name endure for ever; May his name be continued as long as the sun; May men also bless themselves by him; May all nations call him happy.

71.1: That he may judge Thy people with righteousness, and Thy poor with justice.
71.0: [A Psalm] of Solomon. Give the king Thy judgments, O God, and Thy righteousness unto the king's son;
71.3: May he judge the poor of the people, and save the children of the needy, And crush the oppressor.
71.2: Let the mountains bear peace to the people, and the hills, through righteousness.
71.5: May he come down like rain upon the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.
71.4: They shall fear Thee while the sun endureth, and so long as the moon, throughout all generations.
71.7: May he have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the River unto the ends of the earth.
71.6: In his days let the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace, till the moon be no more.
71.9: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
71.8: Let them that dwell in the wilderness bow before him; and his enemies lick the dust.

70.20: Thou wilt increase my greatness, And turn and comfort me.
70.21: I also will give thanks unto Thee with the psaltery, Even unto Thy truth, O my God; I will sing praises unto Thee with the harp, O Thou Holy One of Israel.
70.22: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing praises unto Thee; And my soul, which Thou hast redeemed.
70.23: My tongue also shall tell of Thy righteousness all the day; For they are ashamed, for they are abashed, that seek my hurt.
70.1: Deliver me in Thy righteousness, and rescue me; Incline Thine ear unto me, and save me.
70.0: In Thee, O LORD, have I taken refuge; Let me never be ashamed.
70.3: O my God, rescue me out of the hand of the wicked, Out of the grasp of the unrighteous and ruthless man.
70.2: Be Thou to me a sheltering rock, whereunto I may continually resort, Which Thou hast appointed to save me; For Thou art my rock and my fortress.
70.5: Upon Thee have I stayed myself from birth; Thou art he that took me out of my mother's womb; My praise is continually of Thee.
70.4: For Thou art my hope; O Lord GOD, my trust from my youth.
70.7: My mouth shall be filled with Thy praise, And with Thy glory all the day. .
70.6: I am as a wonder unto many; But Thou art my strong refuge.
70.9: For mine enemies speak concerning me, And they that watch for my soul take counsel together,
70.8: Cast me not off in the time of old age; When my strength faileth, forsake me not.
70.11: O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste to help me.
70.10: Saying: 'God hath forsaken him; Pursue and take him; for there is none to deliver.'
70.13: But as for me, I will hope continually, And will praise Thee yet more and more.
70.12: Let them be ashamed and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; Let them be covered with reproach and confusion that seek my hurt.
70.15: I will come with Thy mighty acts, O Lord GOD; I will make mention of Thy righteousness, even of Thine only.
70.14: My mouth shall tell of Thy righteousness, And of Thy salvation all the day; For I know not the numbers thereof.
70.17: And even unto old age and hoary hairs, O God, forsake me not; Until I have declared Thy strength unto the next generation, Thy might to every one that is to come.
70.16: O God, Thou hast taught me from my youth; And until now do I declare Thy wondrous works.
70.19: Thou, who hast made me to see many and sore troubles, Wilt quicken me again, and bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
70.18: Thy righteousness also, O God, which reacheth unto high heaven; Thou who hast done great things, O God, who is like unto Thee?

79.11: She sent out her branches unto the sea, And her shoots unto the River.

79.2: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up Thy might, And come to save us.

79.4: O LORD God of hosts, How long wilt Thou be angry against the prayer of Thy people?
79.7: O God of hosts, restore us; And cause Thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
79.6: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours; And our enemies mock as they please.
79.9: Thou didst clear a place before it, And it took deep root, and filled the land.
79.8: Thou didst pluck up a vine out of Egypt; Thou didst drive out the nations, and didst plant it.

78.11: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom Their reproach, wherewith they have reproached Thee, O Lord.
78.10: Let the groaning of the prisoner come before Thee; According to the greatness of Thy power set free those that are appointed to death;
78.12: So we that are Thy people and the flock of Thy pasture Will give Thee thanks for ever; We will tell of Thy praise to all generations.
78.1: They have given the dead bodies of Thy servants to be food unto the fowls of the heaven, The flesh of Thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.
78.0: A Psalm of Asaph. O God, the heathen are come into Thine inheritance; They have defiled Thy holy temple; They have made Jerusalem into heaps.
78.3: We are become a taunt to our neighbours, A scorn and derision to them that are round about us.
78.2: They have shed their blood like water Round about Jerusalem, with none to bury them.
78.5: Pour out Thy wrath upon the nations that know Thee not, And upon the kingdoms that call not upon Thy name.
78.4: How long, O LORD, wilt Thou be angry for ever? How long will Thy jealousy burn like fire?
78.7: Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers; Let Thy compassions speedily come to meet us; For we are brought very low.
78.6: For they have devoured Jacob, And laid waste his habitation.
78.9: Wherefore should the nations say: 'Where is their God?' Let the avenging of Thy servants' blood that is shed Be made known among the nations in our sight. .
78.8: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the sake of the glory of Thy name; And deliver us, and forgive our sins, for Thy name's sake.
